Hi! My name is JJ, I'm a 27 year old humanities PhD student in SF, and I'll be teaching an introduction to philosophy of race, gender, and sexuality at CCNY this fall through an exchange program. Mostly a quiet studious type who loves to cook at home, but hoping to spend as much time consuming as much music (and pastrami) as possible while I'm in the city. What I'm looking for is a room to sublet from Aug (dates flexible, somewhere between Aug 1 and Aug 20 is ideal) until Dec (around Dec 20, +/1 10 days). Depending on location and number of roommates, I'm very flexible on price, including studios for under 2k/mo. Greenpoint or Bushwick are ideal neighborhoods for me, I think.
title: Visiting PhD student ISO bklyn room/studio fall sublet

Walking distance to bars, restaurants and stores. I'll also leave you with my fully stocked non-perishables and toiletries, cleaning supplies. 

It would be me, my girlfriend, and my dog coming to NY. 

Let's make something happen!

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
IF YOU SEE THIS LISTING - THAT MEANS I AM STILL LOOKING

hi!
PLEASE read ALL details below before contacting me, thanks!

Happen to have an extra spare bedroom to rent out to help pay some bills?
& at the same time have a good person in your place? :)
Read all about me below!

Looking for EMPTY, good sized room, to fit my stuff, or room that can be made empty,
with someone who already has their own place. 
Looking to use apartment with another person. 
(Please let me know the SIZE in FEET of room! Thanks!)

Looking to stay in Glendale near Ridgewood. 
(BUT sometimes it doesn't work out that way so let me know where in Queens you are)
Middle Village? Forest Hills? Kew Gardens? Rego Park? Elmhurst? Woodside? Sunnyside? Bushwick? Maspeth?
Let me know where you are located exactly, wherever you are. 
(location must have a subway I can walk to let's say 1 mile or less)
Even though I'd like to stay in Queens, I'd be willing to hear out maybe Brooklyn? 
if it's the RIGHT situation that will bring another good situation. 
Let me know full details please. 

I am everything you would want in a roommate. :)
I do not smoke, I do not drink, I do not do drugs. 
I am not a cook. 
I do not need the living room/dining room.
All the apartment decor can be left all yours, I don't need to add anything extra. 
I use all my own toiletries & everything else my own. 
I eat my own food...not yours. 
I use paperplates so I'm not washing dishes. 
I always shut the lights when I leave the room. 
I do not have traffic coming in & out (no guests) 
I do not party.
I don't need any drawers or cabinets in the kitchen, they can be all yours. 
I am respectful of property & privacy.
I am respectful of people above me & below me.
I was brought up right & lock the doors, when leaving or coming. 
I am quiet, HONEST, trustworthy, kind, rare 
& everything else you could ask for in a person that's hard to find much of these days! :)
 
I am from Long Island & moved to Glendale, NY Queens, 3 years ago.
so I had been in Glendale for over 3 years now, in the same place, 
so you know I'm a long term, stable, serious, good person.
Looking for long term only, after all who likes to keep on moving! :)
I've established a connection with the neighbors here & help the elderly out here all of the time, 
(doctors, food shopping, laundry, bills)...
..out of the goodness of my heart without accepting a penny from them. 
I help out people all of the time. 
Now I need help myself, in another good, long term room rental like before.

Non smokers ONLY. You must be a non smoker please. ( I don't care if you only smoke outside, sorry).
No dogs or cats please. 
(I've simply already been in that situation many times before & simply not seeking that anymore)
Please understand. Thanks

More about me: 
I am a female in my 30's, (look in my 20's) & 
if you seriously are wary about someone being in your place, YOU DON'T HAVE TO WORRY WITH ME! :)
I am looking for someone who may be able to already afford the rent or owns the place etc.
& just wants to help relieve some of the rent & not have to deal with any nightmare roommates at the same time,
that may just want some extra money to help pay some bills etc.
I have ALWAYS moved in similar situations before. 
Where someone has a spare room & simply seeking extra money for whatever they want to do with it.
& wanted only a good person in their place at the same time. 
Please see what you can do, what's the best lowest best price you can offer me for the right person,
after reading what I was paying before below. 
I can move asap & I am truly a good person. 
STRICTLY PLATONIC ONLY. (Roommate situation only) 

My average places are 2 years to 2 1/2 years, so you know if I'm moving, 
it's because they are selling the place, or someone is moving, something to this nature,
I am moving because my roommate moved out of state & it was his place. 
Everyone has always gone down in rent with me for that RIGHT person.
This is a fact through my own personal room rentals. 

As FACTS in my own PERSONAL situations, I've been paying $500 ALL included, 
in CASH for an EMPTY room, (with internet/cable, no security), in an apartment share,
in all 5 places I've lived through-out my life, after they've agreed to go down with me for the RIGHT person. 

I move into unique situations where someone just has an extra space 
& wants some extra money with a good person.
I either have gotten a nice size room 
or a smaller room with an extra room attached to it (foyer/hallway/tiny living room) that the person wasn't using
& said I could use it) all depending on the layout this sometimes works. 

I understand this is below your normal market rate, 
but it IS possible & I HAVE done it EVERY TIME before for the right situation & person. 
They've gone down from $700 to $500 for me personally & from $600 to $500 for me.
What can you do in your price after reading my full ad? 
I don't damage anything- I never would & I'm truly one of a kind. :)

I am very helpful around the house on my own doing.
I take out the garbage.
I take out the recycling. 
I could bring in the mail.
I can be the eyes & ears for when you're gone.
I'm a home organizer which is my profession, I organize people's homes,
so you know things will always be nice & organized!
I can't work everyday as it's very physical work & depends on people's busy schedules, when they contact me,
but I pay ON TIME & ALWAYS, each & every month after agreed upon rent, no matter what. 
I stay to myself, always running errands, cleaning or in my room on my device, if I am not organizing for the day. 
I am hardworking no matter what I am doing. 
I clean up after myself, so you don't have to worry about "taking turns cleaning"...
I always am cleaning & doing things to help out.
I'm great at sales so if you're doing shopping at the local supermarkets/pharmacies, 
I can potentially help you get deals & save on money on your food etc. :)
I'm an overall help. :)

I am 1 person with 1 tortoise. (lives in a tank) (NOT WATER)
He eats ONLY greens. 
I've had him since I was 11 years old so you know he's not just some random pet! :)
No real pets.

I am a clean person looking for the same. 
I am aware of my surroundings & be very careful with living in the city 
to make sure not to bring home anything with me! (I hear stories!) 
looking for the same aware person to live with. :)

I use the stove rarely except if I'm making a plain pasta or tea when I'm sick once in a blue moon. 
I pretty much microwave everything, or I have my own microwave if needed.

so if you have an extra room to rent out & & want help paying some bills etc.
& at the same time have the right person come into your place without any problems.......

PLEASE email me with DETAILS, otherwise I will see you did not read my ad, 
The more details the better for clear & easy communication. 
Who  likes to pull teeth!
PLEASE tell me the SIZE of the room IN FEET, (must be empty)
Please tell me the exact location. (What city/section it is in) 
Looking to live with another person. Please tell me who you are & the circumstances.
Looking for the usual share kitchen & bathroom with another person. 
Long term? How long do you plan on staying...
What Floor the room is on?
How much money you could rent to me? 
& anything else you could tell me about your place? 

Please write details as I won't call random phone numbers. 

Thank you so much!!!

{THERE'S NO PLACE LIKE HOME} :)

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Move in: Just 1st. 

So I'm a very simple man .

I enjoy to read. I spend most of my time in the city. But i also like being home and chilling. My job is literally to make youtube videos. So i work for myself and do my own hours. And no, they're not prank videos, they're videos on spirituality and dating advice for men and women. You can look up "Mindful Attraction 2.0" on youtube and see me talk. Great way to get a peek into who i am and stuff. 

Habits:

I smoke weed, play basketball, and have company over like once or twice a week. 

Who I prefer to live with:

This is very important to me. I really prefer someone who has similar hobbies to me and enjoys what I enjoy, like playing basketball, smoking weed and stuff like that. 

One who doesn't mind having me hangout in the living room and one who encourages me to feel comfortable in your home. 

 I know it sounds silly but i just want to be in a place where I can feel at ease. 

THE ROOM :

I prefer a large to medium sized room that's furnished. It doesn't have to be furnished, but i prefer it to be. 

The room would be around $700 to 900 a month. At the moment I have a month's rent and a security deposit.

To everyone else,

Diane continues to flag my post for removal so she can con someone else out of there home and get her kid back. Help me get the word out and repost these everywhere. STOP THIS WORTHLESS SCUM FROM HURTING ANYONE ELSE!

To all who have a room for rent, apartment for rent, house share and anyone who has a rental available... Beware of the Con Woman

DIANE ESTHER EDWARDS

You will probably be contacted by a con woman named Diane Edwards. She cons her way into a persons home, then takes over and even gets the owner removed. This can be verified on ripoffreport.com and ct.jud.gov case lookup. 

https://www.ripoffreport.com/reports/diane-e-edwards/norwalk-connecticut-06854/diane-e-edwards-diane-edwards-diane-e-edwards-con-artist-landlords-beware-of-this-so-876762

She is a horrible human being who preys on good people and has even thrown elderly and young children out into the streets just so she can get out of paying rent. She will order packages from 𝑨𝒎𝒂𝒛𝒐𝒏 and have them sent to your address so they show up the day she comes to see your place, then refuse to leave. When you call the police, she will claim she lives there, show them the "mail" from 𝑨𝒎𝒂𝒛𝒐𝒏 and then you will have to evict her. 

I am the 4th person I can verify that she has done this to. I have lost my home now as a result of what this woman has done but worse is what happened to my daughter, the worst possible thing that could happen to a young girl, because she couldn't go home. 

Diane is now looking for a new home because DCF has taken her daughter away from her and she will not be allowed to have her daughter until she finds another, more suitable home. 

If you wish, I will provide additional information and photos that she provided of her own volition, plus security footage and audio recordings, as well as photos of my home she destroyed if your situation warrants the need. Live in Downtown Brooklyn in a new full service luxury rental building. If outdoor space is important to you then this is the one.

This apartment offers top-of-the-line finishes including brand new kitchen with stainless steel appliances. The bedroom features great views and a walk-in-closet. The bathroom has a terrific storage too. This home has a walk in laundry and high ceilings with stunning panoramic western exposed views of Brooklyn, NY Harbor and the Manhattan Skyline.

This building was completed in 2017. There is a doorman, elevators, bike room, laundry, live-in super, package room, ground floor ATM, 24 hour lobby attendant, and dry cleaning valet. There is a 2nd floor landscaped roof terrace with BBQ gills, outdoor showers and a putting green. There is an elevated park with a cabana pavilion, sun beds and walking paths. There are multiple resident lounge spaces with billiards tables, TV room, and private party space. Other unique features: a glass-enclosed art pavilion showcasing latest works from emerging local artists, an indoor a pet washing and grooming room with exclusive pet walking and concierge services available.

Hot water and heat included. 
Under 3 minutes walk to Trader Joe's and tones of restaurants nearby
The new Downtown Brooklyn has it all. Enjoy DeKalb Market Hall, City Point, Alamo Movie Theater and cultural institutions including Brooklyn Academy of Music, BRIC, and the Mark Morris Dance Center. Close to A, B, C, G, Q, R, 2, 3, 4 and 5 trains.

There are 3 bed rooms and 1 bathroom.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hello!
I'm looking a little early because I want to find someone who is a great fit. In September I will begin looking for a 2 bedroom apartment in Crown Heights- off the Nostrand A or Franklin 3/4 areas. I have all the furniture we need- an awesome IKEA couch, and a big TV (that I never really watch- so feel free).
About me-
Im from Florida and have been living in Crown Heights for 2.5 years. I LOVE Crown Heights because there is culture and community here. I like to create a sense of community everywhere I live- so I'm trying to find an awesome sense of home and love in this one. I'd love a roommate who is interested in that as well!

I'm a certified yoga teacher who actively participates in all the new moon activities/workshops/things she can find. For work, I am a substitute school teacher for the NY Department of Education. My schedule is typically Mon-Friday from 8-3 so I'm an early bird.
When I am home I spend my time cooking vegetarian foods for the week, reading, hanging out with my cat Tigo, and cleaning.
For fun, I like to hang out at parks, go have the occasional drink with friends, try out a new yoga or pilates class, volunteer with NY Cares, the local community garden, and go to the beach. I am also a vocalist and make music with one of my friends who lives in Crown Heights! Music lovers/supporters are welcome <3

The apartment I'm looking for will be a 2 bedroom and ideally we will pay no more than $1150 each for our rooms. I want to find a quiet space where we can rejuvenate from the hectic and at times stressful city.

About you: Not a party monster, a chill person who has an active lifestyle. Cleanliness and health is important to you! Maybe you are a yogi or someone committed to self growth and being a better human! Ideally I'd love to live with someone who is vegetarian, if you aren't, please don't fry stinky sausage in our apartment! Ha!
If this sounds like you- Let's meet up and have a coffee and talk about what we want to create in our living space for October. Then come September- Let's begin our search!

title: WANTED - One Bedroom Apartment

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Thank you for taking the time out to read my ad. Recently, I had an issue with my current apartment.  Being that I do not feel comfortable and safe in that apartment anymore, I have decided that I need to find an apartment soon. Everyone in my  previous apartment lived harmoniously. The chores were split and done by instinct, because we did not like to live in filth. We all respected each other's privacy , food , and personal things. Moving forward, in the paragraph below I will describe myself. 

About Me: 
As a New York native, my communication and interpersonal skills are at their highest peak. I am a 23 year old male seeking a roommate who understands, not only the importance of hard work, but life in general. Currently, I am an Uber driver and I also work full time as a driver for a bread company within the Metropolitan area. Needless to say, I am always on the go. Non-smoker (it does not matter if my roommates smoke or not). I like animals, as long as you keep them clean and they don't invade or destroy my things, I have no issues with them being around. I am single with no dependents. I am non-religious. I am orderly and clean and just a laid-back person. I volunteer to do things without being told, that's just how I am. For example, if I see the dishes are piled up, I will wash them without looking around and asking who created them. I like to party sometimes, but I have mostly out grown that phase. Overall, I'm a hard-working laid-back guy that mind my business.

What I'm Seeking:
A private room/studio within the price range of $700-900 a month, which can be unfurnished, semi-furnished, or fully furnished, including ALL utilities/Wi-Fi/AC. If laundry is on-site, that would be great, but not necessary. The bathroom could be shared but a private one is more than welcome too. Bed-Stuy , Crown Heights And Flatbush locations would be ideal. All identities are welcome: any racial/ethnic identity, Lesbian/Gay/bisexual/transgender/etc. identities, national identity or other identity. It doesn't matter if the roommates are smokers or not. I would prefer one roommate only two at the most. What I seek in a roommate is what I offer as one: trust, decency, fairness and thoughtfulness
I will provide a security deposit to hold the room and then first month's rent upon moving in (few days before the move).
If this fits the criteria for you, please reach out and tell me about yourself and your apartment/ the room. Feel free to include pictures if you have them. I am available anytime contact me via cell  show contact info
) if I don't answer please text. 
Thank You,
DeMarrius

title: 2/3 Bedroom wanted

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hello! I am moving to NYC, and I am looking for 
A.) Potential roommates who would like to search for apartments to share together
Or 
B.) Rooms that are already available

I am looking to come around the end of June or the beginning of July :) 

About Me:
I am going to school for nursing, and I'll be doing my first two years of school online so I can work, and then either move back home for the nursing program at UAB college, or stay in NYC, since I'll have in state tuition. I am coming from Alabama (Bet you didn't expect that huh? Haha), so it will be quite the cultural exchange. Which is okay with me, I feel like I need this city to mature me more and mold me into an adult that has truly seen it all. I think that's part of the problem today with people is that as young adults, in their main years of personal & social development, the years where they finally have the chance to do what they want to do and not what their parents want them to want to do, they don't get out , they haven't seen people who are different from them, so now as adults they don't care about people who aren't like them, because all they've ever interacted with is the town that's raised them. They don't have empathy, the can't relate. They don't feel like they can extend kindness to others unlike them. 
I'm just really trying to get out while I can. These years are mine, I'm not pregnant by some crappy boy from my hometown, I'm not following my high school sweetheart to college, I'm not taking care of my sick mother, I'm not battling cancer.
I'm the only one I have to worry about. 
I believe showing myself "The World" (so dramatic, I know. I'm sure NYC is just a big trashcan but I've been obsessed with going there since I was 14. LET ME BE EXCITED LOL)
Is the biggest, most kind, gesture of love I can offer my forever self. I know it's hard to move to NYC, but not near as hard to "make it". I get that people are mean and stuff is expensive, and I'm young so I should try to live with my parents as long as I can, I get that. I'm not near as naive as I probably sound, being this exited to move. However, the city has a population of 8.1 million people. Are you really going to tell me it's ridiculous to think there's not people in my exact situation, doing it? Getting jobs? Making money? Making friends? Seeing shit?
I'm young, I'm healthy, physically and mentally. I have all my limbs, I can work long hours with little sleep and still function. I'm willing to learn anything. I actually WANT to be in the city, so I'll work for it. I'm in America? I realize there's other countries that have just as many freedoms as the U.S if not more. I know. But this country is mine and has so many opportunities for me. I'm so able. One day I'll be old and probably have some some kind of thing that makes me not as good then that I am now. I'm not gonna be like this forever, NOW is the time to do the hard stuff. 
Speaking of, I'm only 18!!! 
I know everyone who even thought of offering me their room probably just sighed and if they haven't already, pressed the back button to send them back to the list so they can find someone else. I get it lol. I don't have credit!!! I turned 18 less than 6 months ago, I don't have a credit score. But I know someone needs rent money just as bad as I need a place to rent, so they'll accept my first and last months rent, my bag of foreign shit I brought them from Alabama, and move on haha. 
My budget is $800 a month. For the BEST room, location, and roommates I'd go up to $900, don't be scared to send me rooms for $900 :) 
I can give you 2 months rent. First and last, first and second? Last month and a security deposit? First month and a security deposit? I don't care what ya call it. 2 months rent is what I have 
I'm so not picky. As long as there's no bugs and you're not a sex offender I don't care (I'm saying this and I already know someone is going to send me some crazy, off the wall room like, "it doesn't have bugs and we're not sex offenders here :)" . Pls don't haha) 
I don't mind a sketchy location, seeing how I've lived in a "sketchy" location too, and it wasn't even actually sketchy. There just wasn't any white people and men sat outside wearing wife beater tank tops. They were still good people. Kids were still being raised with loving parents. 
I don't smoke cigarettes or do drugs. I don't mind it but I do NOT wanna live in a trap house. I've drank occasionally? It's not my thing. I'll drink every now and then but I can't see myself at 21, using my own money on alcohol. Not my thing, but it's okay if it's yours! I don't party but it's okay if you do.
I'm pretty shy at first but once I warm up I'm the best (Just kidding haha).
I'm quiet, I clean up after myself, and I'm very considerate of others. 
I have applications put in at multiple hospitals in the city for nurse tech positions. Here in Alabama I work 3-4 12 hour night shifts a week, so I'll be at work during the night, and asleep during the day, the times I do work. I've only applied for night shift positions, plus 2-3 day shift positions. So chances are I'll be working night shift. 
Do you know what this means? This means you get like HALF a roommate, who's paying full rent!!! 
If you have dogs that's great. I'm never going to get upset at you or your precious sweet amazing perfect puppy because I step in dog poop. I love dogs. I love cats too!
That's really all about me, I'll be happy to answer any questions you may have :) 
I have ads in multiple sections on Craigslist, a few Facebook groups. An app or two. Don't be alarmed or think I'm "fake" (how you fake look for an apartment, I have no idea). It's just me

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
If you are looking for a job as a Nanny or babysitter that's fine. If you are looking for full time work with a free room and salary, there are Nanny sites that do government background checks, fingerprint checks, credit checks etc, before you work with children. Sometimes these jobs include free room and board. In NYC you have to be professional in your credentials, not just post an ad that you want a babysitting job with a free room, cause you have no money. Parents can afford to be very picky here.

You have to be qualified to work with children! Licensed early childhood teachers or nurses can apply. These jobs are competitive as all jobs are in NYC. No one is going to feel sorry for you here and give you a free room in exchange for working with their children! That's dangerous and murders of children by inexperienced Nannys are in the newspapers and TV.
title: There is NO Free Room for Babysitter/Nanny

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
If you want to move to New York City from another state, then fine. The way to do this is to find a job where you live and save up money to move.

Many young people here think someone in NYC can host them for free, for a few months, while they look for a job? No. No one can afford that. This is a roommate or rental site. People who have a room need to charge MARKET RATE, because their landlord is charging THEM market rate.

So if you have a dream to move to NYC that's great. Save your money and move here. Sure some people can move here in college, they have rich parents and can prove it with bank statements. It's expensive to live here. Don't expect to move here with no money.

PLEASE, PLEASE do not come here to go to private college and take out enormous student loans for tuition and rent in Manhattan! If you DO decide to go to school here, NO ONE has to live a 5 minute walk to school. You DON'T have to live in the Village, Upper East Side or Upper West Side. Make do with a Metrocard and commute from Queens or whatever borough. This student loan debt to pay Manhattan rent is SICK.

If you are looking to "barter" for no money, please list your ad under "barters". Not this section.
title: MOVING TO NYC?

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
So many people want to barter housekeeping for a private room! This must be very common in other parts of the country. It is NOT welcome in NYC. The real estate prices here are VERY HIGH. They are also in HIGH DEMAND. Any one with a separate room has their choice of many people wanting the room for MARKET RATE. A housekeeping job is part time, a few hours a week and pays minimum wage. It does not equal the rent for a room in an apt here.

Out of Towners looking for a free bartered room usually demand Manhattan! It's a $2000/month room and your housekeeping skills aren't worth that much! Then you want furnishings, free internet and utilities! And some ask for a private apt!

Anyone looking for a roommate is not saying "Hey! Why don't I just get a free housekeeper instead!!!" Anyone looking for a professional maid goes to an agency, not Craigslist. It's a low wage job, unless you are working for the Trumps or Clintons.

And then you have ALL THESE REQUIREMENTS FOR YOUR FREE ROOM! What a joke! Like "No Cooking, just errand running! No babysitting!" Please just stay home if you can't afford to pay rent!
title: We cannot barter housekeeping for FREE private room

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Please take note out of towners! There is NO neighborhood in Manhattan that has a room for rent for $800/mo! Be realistic and research the going rates on the internet! Yikes, for 20 somethings you certainly aren't internet savvy!

If you can't afford the rents here, Do NOT come here. Anyone who is looking for a roommate cannot afford to do you a favor. No one is willing to pay 75% of the rent, so you can pay 25%. Grow up!

Try to be realistic about the apt. No millionaire is renting out rooms. There is no private extra bathroom. Yes you might have to walk up. A private entrance is called a studio apt. And no one has "extra" rooms. You're lucky to get ANYTHING! Demand exceeds supply!

And yes you will have to take the subway. Count on a one hour commute average. Each way. No one walks to school or work.

$800/month for a room in the Bronx, more in Queens and Brooklyn, MUCH more in Manhattan.

Yes we are all struggling and juggling here. A listing of all YOUR many requirements is unwanted and insulting to all of us who struggle to live here.
title: There is NO Room for rent downtown W Village $800

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Most singles looking for roommates want OTHER SINGLES. Not couples. Reason is simple. Why share the bathroom and kitchen with 2 people, when you can share with one? Most 2 bedroom and 3 bedroom apts have ONE bathroom! No these apts weren't meant for 3 couples of 6 adults and it's illegal against fire code besides. 

Couples feel they're entitled to have a second person to live for free. No for your information, if you are part of a couple, you MIGHT get a room by paying EXTRA for the extra roommate! Novel idea huh?

Most likely, you won't have any luck getting a couple, "buy one, get one free" room. Your best bet is looking for a studio. Or looking in a much less desirable hard to fill area.

Ok a studio can run you $1350-$1500/mo in Queens. Much less in Staten Island, about $1000 (but you might need a car). Less in the Bronx, maybe a studio for about $1100? Cost more in Brooklyn. Manhattan studios start at $2000, so I guess you can't walk to work! You must pay first, last months security and one months brokers fee. Nothing in your budget is "walkable" or "30 minute commute".  or 2 blocks to the subway! Try an hour. Don't know about the interns that want a place for a few months. Probably they can just stay home.

Or move to NJ. Look in Newport, it's near a Mall.

Last week I saw an ad for 3 adults and 2 dogs who want to squeeze into ONE ROOM to save for an apt! Uh NO! That's against the fire codes and cause for eviction!
title: There is NO Pay for One get One FREE: ROOM 4 COUPLES!!! $800

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Attention out of towners! Landlords are not looking on Craiglist for "cheap" renters to fill their apts! There are 10 people in a day who want to rent an apt!

If you want an apt in NYC you really must go to a broker. Sometimes they will have no-fee apts. Unless you know someone who has a vacancy in their building, then this is the way it is done. You might get lucky and find one in a million on the internet, but more likely you will be sleeping on the subway. You will mostly have no luck posting on here and begging for a no broker "cheap" apt. It's a crapshoot. Is that what you want?

No I don't work for a real estate company. but plenty of times I have rented out my apt and I put up an ad on CL getting TONS of replies in one day. Landlords can pick and choose. There are no "cheap" or "reasonable" apts.

Much more sensible to get your own apt and then advertise for your own roommate. Yeah, obviously it's cheaper to have your roommate pay all the fees and furnish the place too. Then you want 2 people to split the room!!! Why would anyone take 2 people to share the bathroom and kitchen when they can have one? Some posters even want 4 people to squeeze into a room while they save for an apt!!! Or 3 adults and 2 huge dogs for $200/mo!!! This is illegal and against FDNY laws. This is cause for eviction.

You really have to research what apts are going for and divide that by the amount of bedrooms. Finances are all math. If you are listing a BELOW MARKET price for "room wanted" don't be shocked if you get no real responses. Fingers crossed won't do it. I have time to write educational posts, but MOST PEOPLE ARE WAY TOO BUSY TO STRAIGHTEN YOU OUT. And by the way, in Manhattan space is very expensive. No one has extra empty rooms that they can rent out for a lowball price. Millionaires are not looking for roommates.

Yesterday someone wants to rent a room for 7 cats! Huh?
title: Wake up and smell the coffee

I'm looking for space in Manhattan or Brooklyn.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hello all,

My name is Jorge Barrios and I will be an intern for Google this summer at the NYC office.

I arrived to NYC this morning, and I am in desperate need of housing. I will be staying in temporary housing from May 16 - May 26, so my time is running short! I received a relocation bonus from Google to cover my housing for the summer, but I was scammed and I lost the majority of it. So this is why I am making this post, to save myself from my impending homelessness. 

I will be available during these 10 days to visit and tour apartments and meet in person.

If you happen to know of any apartments that offer subleasing or cheap rent (something below 1500 probably) and doesnt require an initial deposit(I'm pretty poor at the moment, I really can't put down a lot) , please let me know. I dont care about the quality of the apartment, or the location (not that I really have a choice). I just ask that it have basic furnishing, such as a bed and kitchen appliances. 

Please anyone, help me out. I'm in a grave situation and I need to find something quickly. Google pays their interns well, so you can count on me to pay my rent on time! I am responsible and dutiful. Although I don't have much to offer upfront, I will definitely have enough money to make my rent payments at the end of every month. 

Thank you for your time!!!!

do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
title: Sublet apartment/room needed ASAP for Google Intern

I'm currently in the process of rebuilding my independence; getting on my feet. I currently have a SEPS VOUCHER. If your not familiar with the program below is a description of the incentives.
The Special Exit and Prevention Supplement (SEPS) 

Some incitives a landlord will receive
Security Voucher, prorated portion for early move ins, full first month rent choice of rental portions of 11 months ( 11 months rent paid to owner in advance) $3500 landlord bonus in addition to reservation hold equivalent to 1 month rent. Broker fee not to exceed 1 month rent. 

I currently have a monthly rent allowance not to exceed $1213 per month for a studio or 1 bedroom. Feel free to give me a call or send me a text.  

Have a great day

Nicole

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hi All! 

I'm a chill, Afro Futurism fan, comic book loving, sci-fi writing nerdy foodie from NYC looking for a new place to call home. 

I am currently living in Washington Heights and I LOVE it here but I've recently graduated from college and looking for a more chill situation. 

I prefer locations in Manhattan, particularly Washington Heights, Harlem, Inwood, and the Upper West Side... but I suppose I'm flexible depending on the space and personality(ies) of roommate(s). I'm able to afford up to $700 a month. 

I totally enjoy my personal space, I like my quiet time, reading books, listening to audio books and chilling but I can also get into movie nights, bar meet ups, and communal cooking time with roommate(s). I work at a private liberal arts college downtown in the IT department. I'm mentally and emotionally intact. Being communicative and understanding of each other's feelings and opinions are very important to me. I'm queer and LGBTQ friendly, have a diverse group of friends, and often find myself in very socially just environments. 

If any of this sounds interesting to you and you'd like to talk more please feel free to contact me. I'm looking to move June or July 1st. I'm somewhat flexible for the perfect space. 

Talk soon! 
Jermaine

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hi. Can you help me please? I'm a GAY Mixed Black Man - Very LGBTQ Friendly & I immediately in need to rent a clean room RIGHT NOW for $125.00 cash (no deposit), in which I'll stay in for the dates from Sunday, May 20, 2018 thru Saturday, May 27, 2018. Has anyone in Manhattan lost EVERYTHING & maybe you can relate. I lost my home, my job, my savings, & starting over with complete new beginning, and every step that I take for the better seems to only result in the worse. THIS IS ME RIGHT NOW- just got a new job. Just me Being mixed black ethnicity has me still discriminated upon. Being poor has me judged as homeless because of my over-washed clothing but that's all I have that can fit on my body. Being big, tall, & with a thick body that's somewhat feminine because of flabby, has some people thinking I'm transgender-but it's my body. Being and looking just a little older than 40 has most people that age, has people thinking that I'm over experienced with life. But all I have is Just enough money in my pocket to get by, to cover a clean room for $125.00 for one week. I'm suffering to make ends meet, being able to eat, drink, walk, & talk has me very thankful to GOD although I have No Family, since I'm Gay & like the taste-touch-& feel of good size dick. I have No Friends, since they can turn on you in a blink of an eye especially with no money and they're being masculine heterosexual. No one in NYC seems to want to help and everyone sees that since I have eczema/psoriasis that I was born with & inherited from think that I'm never to have sex or be spoken to or to be touched. I've been picked on in school as a child and now as an adult, but it's okay, I've now been able to accept being and feeling isolated--there's a reason for it. My deformity - I have blood vessel sensitivity, internal/external inflammation, hormone deficiency, & very low immunity which imbalances my entire body. With osteoarthritis and arthritis I deal with daily 'on & off' cramps. I'm seriously that 'boy in the bubble' that everyone treats as an complete outcast. Every moment of the day I'm depressed, wanting another being with a samaritan heart who wouldn't mind being my other half, that can walk with me on my journey. Who knows, I might just choose to become transsexual-I've always been somewhat feminine with my character and some of my actions but not that flamboyant. I don't mind if other men are like that. I have a thick beard facial hair, salt & pepper head hair, & speak with proper verbal etiquette. I accept anyone, just as they are. Why would I judge. Only GOD judges us all. I intake prescribed holistic vitamins & pain medication daily. I just need a residence that's clean and a good habitat that's quiet, that I can hot shower (in the morning & at night) & relieve body waste. A Place that I can just reheat a little food or 'whip up' a quick meal. A place that I can have a private bed that can hold 363 lbs and 6'3 in height. A place that I can have ventilation-an open window-I need air to help with my breathing. I don't smoke anything at all & I don't drink alcoholic beverages. I just go to work, physical therapy due to congested blood flow throughout my body, particularly my arms & legs. I. daily listen to my MP3 or watch movies on my mobile phone and stay to myself. I'll go to the movies or dine at a eatery once in a blue moon'. I'm a complete loner and to many people a complete loser. To some, I'm a fag - a sissy and to others - a nobody. I just want someone who genuinely can reply with a genuine heart. If a relationship came with it- okay. But acceptance & equality of me being in the LGBTQ community has also blocked me. If you're transgender - I don't mind. I'm just me & you're just you. Can you please help me if you care? I don't have pictures of myself & I don't have sex with just anyone unless it's a connection between you and I and we use condoms. I can get a guy off and give massages. I'm tidy & organized and I have only one carry-case and shoulder bag that holds all my belongings. Can someone just see my heart and not pre-determine without asking me what you want to know. I'm sane & very respectful. I'll answer you. My new co-worker says I'm unique, genuine, abnormal in my own way & just not as everyone else in this world. If you're unique, genuine, & abnormal in you're own way, then reply respectfully. If we're all the same then this entire world would very boring. If we were all normal & the same, then, we wouldn't have affection or interest in getting to know one another. Right or Wrong? If you have the same mentality or experiencing life with obstacles as me then I implore you & await your reply. I only ask from whoever you are.....understanding Please do not ask for me to send pictures of how I look. I have a very small dick so you wouldn't need to see it & besides I'm a bottom. I'm not on any social media nor do I want to sign up to any website or forum. I'm too 'old school'. I don't have pics of me. If you're renting immediately then we can meet, face to face if you're SERIOUS. Legitimately there are some really good- hearted, good-natured people who do not need to see pictures of someone else. Rent to me from your heart. This is an ad for legitimate help from a Samaritan that has a clean room that I can stay in for $125.00 for one week please. Thank You in Advance and accept my heartfelt honest and seeking for your serious generous help. 
:-)

Hi there!

Looking to rent a room, preferably with no more than one other person in the apartment. I don't mind sharing a bathroom, kitchen, etc. I'm super clean, neat, respectful and reliable and am looking for someone to be in that zone. I work as a financial analyst in Brooklyn and have been at my job for about 4 years. Originally from SF California. I work M-F 9-5 and on weekends I keep things pretty chill by catching up on errands or going out and finding something going on in the city to keep me entertained.  Looking to move no later than June 1 but earlier if the right place presents itself. If you send a me link I will not open it. 

Few things to keep in mind:
-I have a well behaved 20 pound pooch named Cisco. Not a barker. Trained to lounge only on his blanket, not on the whole couch. I also own a Roomba which I will gladly bring with me!
-3-5 month or month to month lease term flexibility. Not looking for a one year commitment. I'm not saying I won't stay one year if I really like the place but I'd like to have the option. 
-I prefer an elevator building. Top floor would be amazing!
-The room should be able to fit a queen sized bed, a dresser and have a closet. Very basic necessity
-Location doesn't have to be exactly Murray Hill. Will consider other neighborhoods with the right conditions.

Let me know if you have any questions. Again if you send me a link I will not open it. Please be legit.

If this sounds appealing let me know what you have available and lets chat.

Thanks

As an individual who lost both her grandmothers as a young age, I would love the opportunity to live, and foster a bond with, a female senior citizen. As a law student, I will be a quiet living companion, spending the majority of the day at the school, the library, or studying at home. Moreover, tea time and coffee breaks with "grandma" would provide the perfect break from studying! As a first-generation American and daughter of immigrants, I was raised to have a strong level of respect and appreciation for my elders. To that end, I would be happy to act as a companion and assist with daily tasks to make your life easier.   

Please feel free to contact me by replying to this ad to set up a phone call or in-person interview. I look forward to hearing from you!
title: Student Seeking Housing: "Grandma's Spare Room"

Our current roommate is leaving us sadly and we are looking to find someone (NO COUPLES) to replace her on the lease starting June 1. Rent is $1,050 not including utilities - utilities are about $80 a month. Price is non-negotiable.

- Robyn is 36 and is a district manager

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Available for 1031 Like Kind Exchange.  No Capital Gains Taxes. 
Welcome to this historic circa 1773 Reuben Loveren center chimney post-and-beam house! Exceptional in every way, this pre-revolutionary home was featured in NH Magazine and noted as a "well-appointed rural retreat." The home was thoroughly renovated, keeping the antique features combined with modern-day amenities. The Previous sellers put over $1.3 million into the home.  You will find six fireplaces, alluring murals, wide pine floors, and Dunlap craftsmanship. The home has 4 oversized bedrooms with fireplaces and 5 bathrooms.  The 40'x20' great room has a soaring ceiling that continues into the professional chef's kitchen with a separate prep room/pantry. There is direct access from the house to the 85-foot beautifully restored post-and-beam barn that can have up to ten stalls for horses or other uses. Enjoy a salt water pool, patio, beautiful stone walls, and over eleven acres of level fields. Exceptional Country Living! Many fine furnishings available. The full list of attributes is ready for your review upon request.  Pictures available upon request.  
I am looking to permanently trade this unique property for a Manhattan Apartment or other upscale areas in Boston or Miami Beach.  Other areas would be considered upon submission.  This property is also for sale at $1,250,000.00

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
I'd like to swap a Desert Hot Springs/Palm Springs 1BR condo for a similar residence in NYC/Manhattan. My travel schedule is flexible. But I'm probably most interested in swapping sometime in Spring. My apartment is available throughout the year. The swap does not have to be simultaneous. Please reply to this ad if you're interested.

I have a 1BR condo (700 sq ft) in a quiet, well maintained, mid-century building located in the Spa Zone of Desert Hot Springs, CA. 1 Bedroom (queen size mattress), full Bath, Living Room, Dining Area and Kitchen. On-site laundry and off-street parking available.

This beautiful mid-century modern, spacious condo is a fully furnished apartment and provides a comfortable and stylish 'home away from home' nestled in the hills of Desert Hot Springs. Apartment comes with a full kitchen, walk-in closet, central heat and air conditioning. Original mid-century details and furnishings throughout. The open floor plan lend itself to casual and relaxed living.

The front doors lead out to a large patio with palm trees and a pool. Your backdrop during the warm sunny days and star filled desert nights will be the spectacular views of the Little San Bernardino Mountains. Enjoy the panoramic mountain and valley views and the nearby windmill fields. It's a perfect setting to simply relax and rejuvenate.

The apartment is freeway close, near bus lines, shopping, grocery stores, and restaurants. It's a 15 minute drive to Palm Springs, 30 minutes to Joshua Tree, 2 hours to San Diego or Los Angeles, and just 20 minutes to the best discount shopping at Cabazon Outlet Mall. Two of the areas premiere golf courses are less than a 5 min drive. Nearby is a city park with tennis and basketball courts, a baseball field, and skating course.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Are you interested in hosting an International high school student from China? We are actively looking for welcoming and supportive host families to open their hearts and homes to students attending schools in the Jersey City area starting August of 2018. 

These young people from China are seeking an American academic and cultural experience. They have all completed an international preparatory program, with a proven track record for excelling academically. Our students have been thoroughly screened to ensure they will be a good fit for placement at these private schools and are eager to learn and experience American culture. 

What is required to host an international student? Our host families provide:

A comfortable and cultural-enriching environment
Transportation to and from school (students may ride the school bus) 
Three nutritious meals each day
A separate bedroom (bathrooms may be shared) 
Warm, supportive parental supervision of this young adult 

In exchange for opening up your home, you'll enjoy an amazing cultural experience and bond with a student who becomes part of your family. You and your Chinese student will also receive ongoing academic and social support from the highly-skilled and trained staff at New Oasis International Education. Lastly, you will receive a monthly stipend from New Oasis. By hosting you can provide a global experience to your local community - all you have to do is say YES!

Interested please apply today: https://tbiedu.secure.force.com/HostFamilyApplication/

In exchange for opening up your home, you'll enjoy an amazing cultural experience and bond with a student who becomes part of your family. You and your Chinese student will also receive ongoing academic and social support from the highly-skilled and trained staff at New Oasis International Education. Lastly, you will receive a monthly stipend from New Oasis. By hosting you can provide a global experience to your local community - all you have to do is say YES!

Interested please apply today: https://tbiedu.secure.force.com/HostFamilyApplication/
title: Host Family for an International High School Student

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
I am a male professional moving temporarily from London/Paris to NYC to set up a business operation in the U.S for a tech start-up. I will be working in Midtown. I am looking to find a great flatmate/roommate with a nice suitable place in a safe, clean, good area of Manhattan within walking distance to the subway. I am well-educated and traveled, I am bright, outgoing and quite personable, clean/neat, respectful and cherish privacy. My budget is flexible, but I am not looking for anything way too expensive (around US$2,000.00/month would be ideal). Must have Wi-Fi and some nice amenities including wash and dryer inside the place or at least to be in the same building. 

I prefer a non-smoking place with no pets. My ideal move-in date is in June or early July at the latest.

Please respond with a brief introduction of yourself, a description of the place and building including photos, information about the area, and the best way to contact you. Thanks !
title: European tech entrepreneur moving to NYC seeking great place/flatmate

title: Our Veterans are in need of housing #27

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Years after the devastation of Hurricane Sandy, hundreds of New York homeowners who were hit hardest are finally nearing the last stages of re-entering their homes. These families need temporary housing while their homes undergo major construction.

This presents a tremendous opportunity for brokers and landlords who service the affected areas.

The Skyton Group is partnering with Temporary Housing Services (THS) to help homeowners find and pay for temporary housing so their homes can be elevated or reconstructed by the NYC Build it Back program.

Our clients are homeowners and working professionals who need assistance as they overcome the last remnants of Sandy's devastation. They are fully vetted tenants who will be quality additions to your properties and communities.

Quality rental units are needed ASAP!

We need accessible homes, pet-friendly homes, and 1-4 bedroom homes in the Sandy-affected areas of NYC. Skyton's expert team helps to refer homeowners to landlords and real estate professionals working in these areas.

Through this program, qualified placements are given housing with rent, broker fees, security deposit, and pet deposits all paid through the city - on time, with every dollar paid.

No nonsense - just qualified tenants!

There are no special agreements or fine print. You can deal directly to homeowners using your own lease agreement. And there are no income restrictions or lengthy applications for homeowners, landlords, or brokers.

If you're interested, call me directly at  show contact info
 ext. 2 or fill out our online contact form: http://www.skytonregroup.com/build-it-back/

title: Get fully vetted and screened tenants for your vacancies #29

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
The Skyton Real Estate Group is proud to participate in New York's Olmstead Housing Subsidy (OHS) program.

This exciting opportunity helps landlords and property owners place seniors and those with disabilities in better housing, all of whom can maintain FULL support services from the state. You will receive full rental subsidy through this program, with no fees or other costs.

Skyton can help you enroll in this program, helping you turn vacant properties into quality housing for deserving seniors, allowing them to leave behind unpleasant nursing home environments, unstable housing, or even homelessness. 

Your potential tenants will be completely vetted, and will meet the following criteria:

Age 55 or older (18+ with a documented chronic disability)
Enrolled in Medicaid
Qualified for nursing home placement by New York State (UAS-NY)
Currently residing in a nursing home, homeless or unstably housed
Approaching (or past) 120+ consecutive days in a nursing home over the past two years

To take part in this risk-free, highly rewarding opportunity, contact the Skyton Real Estate Group at  show contact info
, ext. 4.

title: Host Parents Needed

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Drove from New York to California to pursue acting; money ran out, lossed my job and I'm homeless... Nevertheless.. Can you get me a Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts or Subway egift card so I can use their app for bagel, coffee or subway sandwich? Living in my SUV and just need food to get by. Amazon Locker me food and hygienic products...I also have Venmo and Cash App.I can also meet you at a gas station for some gas or a box or food; you can also purchase food at a restaurant and I'll pick up at a location...If you have something in your apartment you want to get rid off and think I can sell it on Craigslist? I'll take that as well...I've provided many options and I'm grateful for any option.
Thank you kindly, and I trust that the universe will grant my wish...

Text me if you like  show contact info
.--

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
The Skyton Real Estate Group is proud to participate in New York's Olmstead Housing Subsidy (OHS) program.

This exciting opportunity helps landlords and property owners place seniors and those with disabilities in better housing, all of whom can maintain FULL support services from the state. You will receive full rental subsidy through this program, with no fees or other costs.

Skyton can help you enroll in this program, helping you turn vacant properties into quality housing for deserving seniors, allowing them to leave behind unpleasant nursing home environments, unstable housing, or even homelessness. 

Your potential tenants will be completely vetted, and will meet the following criteria:

Age 55 or older (18+ with a documented chronic disability)
Enrolled in Medicaid
Qualified for nursing home placement by New York State (UAS-NY)
Currently residing in a nursing home, homeless or unstably housed
Approaching (or past) 120+ consecutive days in a nursing home over the past two years

To take part in this risk-free, highly rewarding opportunity, contact the Skyton Real Estate Group at  show contact info
, ext. 4.

title: Our Veterans are in need of housing #27

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Years after the devastation of Hurricane Sandy, hundreds of New York homeowners who were hit hardest are finally nearing the last stages of re-entering their homes. These families need temporary housing while their homes undergo major construction.

This presents a tremendous opportunity for brokers and landlords who service the affected areas.

The Skyton Group is partnering with Temporary Housing Services (THS) to help homeowners find and pay for temporary housing so their homes can be elevated or reconstructed by the NYC Build it Back program.

Our clients are homeowners and working professionals who need assistance as they overcome the last remnants of Sandy's devastation. They are fully vetted tenants who will be quality additions to your properties and communities.

Quality rental units are needed ASAP!

We need accessible homes, pet-friendly homes, and 1-4 bedroom homes in the Sandy-affected areas of NYC. Skyton's expert team helps to refer homeowners to landlords and real estate professionals working in these areas.

Through this program, qualified placements are given housing with rent, broker fees, security deposit, and pet deposits all paid through the city - on time, with every dollar paid.

No nonsense - just qualified tenants!

There are no special agreements or fine print. You can deal directly to homeowners using your own lease agreement. And there are no income restrictions or lengthy applications for homeowners, landlords, or brokers.

If you're interested, call me directly at  show contact info
 ext. 2 or fill out our online contact form: http://www.skytonregroup.com/build-it-back/

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
It is amazing how people looking for room under $1,000 month have certain demands:

Private bathroom
good neighborhood
private entrance
No security deposit
weekly payment and deposit = 1 week deposit only, hello!!!!
near the subway 
I won't even mention those that want a place to live in NYC for under $500, these are living in la la Land or want to be exploited one way or another. 

Parking spot included, wrong city baby! if paid parking spot is a rarity....

Couples wanting  discount 2 for the price of one, the great majority of  couples are nightmare, double  trouble, don't take couples, you better off boarding pets. Couples are so cute, they want other people subsidize their existence. Even in rare occasions when couples are descent, they are nuisance,  always on or the other will be around, more utility, bathroom use, kitchen use, fridge space, more noise, two people together are  noisier for sure, ONE WAY OF ANOTHER JUST BY DOING THEIR EVERYDAY MUNDANE things, they fight, they can become two against one or against all, nothing good usually comes out from having couples, it is not for nothing that most people won't accept couples, and if two people can't afford a studio, be suspicious defend your best interest not theirs. Still if you want to do it add at least 50% more to the rent, if you have more other roommates more often than not  adding couples will stir the balance and peace

Are you thinking about renting a spare room or have a lease on your name? Think twice:

- Good number (of course there are exceptions - pay attention to the word exception) are people that can barely survive in NYC, no credits, low income or unreliable source of income.

-They can't pass the credit verification from property management companies, so they go to the informal craigslist world where the verification is lapsed. 

-They will be late paying rent but will not give up smoking or and their green herbal supplement 

-Cooking their own meal rarely an option, why save money on take out if you can live beyond your means and can be constantly late with the rent, screw the landlord or roommate.

- why Give up or less beer and frequent visits to bars?  no way Jose. 

- Usually the ones that can least afford are the one to have guest over more often than should and be the loudest asses and have all this speech of right and wrong and what is acceptable, surprisingly nothing in favor of the others. 

-The first day of the month  the person always have excuses to be late with rent, first few times will be a couple days, than it will just increase to 5 days, 7, 10...... patterns, patterns, don't ignore.

-Everyone lies, verify everything, do not trust  references, contact former landlord, make sure they are the actual landlord not some jerk posing as landlord or roommate, check utility bills paid on time, check credit, check employment and employment, check bank accounts. Some people are very convincing, and obviously we are not equipped with instantaneous  polygraph,  most people have invested more in being deceptive than doing the right thing, the great majority have a sense of entitlement that is hard to be believed, and they truly believe they are entitled to whatever their twisted mind decides, filtering these a variety of nut cases is nearly impossible, at least put in place clauses that may help you deal with them appropriately. 

-Never accept labor as payment or partial payment, it does not work each party will very soon have opposite definitions, dissaster for sure. 

-If you do not want smoker, Check person teeth, if yellowish, 99% chance they are smoker, 90% of smokers lie about it, and it is just a matter of time before they start smoking in the house. 

-Don't be shy, ask for credit card, debit card statement, see how much they owe, how much they spend in bars, restaurant and unnecessary entertainment and match against their salary, people that don't share are the ones you don't want. 
Although a few  people that are in bad situations sometimes are for some unfortunate events, the great majority are not, so since you can't be sure, avoid at all cost. 

-check craigslist posting, you will notice that are people posting the same thing over and over for months and years, some describe situations that could not be true several months later, one that sticks out is a woman posting that she has to move because the landlady sold the property, it must be the longest sale closing  in history, two years later the tale  is the same, she also mentions that she is such a catch that landlord lower her rent instead of raising, by the way she wants a place for $500 or less with all included.

-If you do not want weed in your house, don't ask, just invite the person if they want to share a joint, it works every time. Of course in NYC 90% of people are week smoker, but not all pot heads are alike, some will burn your place down. 

-People with pets: even if you love pets, check the pets first, better if you pay a surprise visit where the person live ask for the vet bills on the spot, people can fake it, better be by surprise,see if shots and check up visits are up to date, if they can't afford a pet it is unlikely they can afford rent or sacrifice one for the other, everyone is animal lover and responsible with their pets, until they move in and you will learn firsthand their definition  of responsible, some people even move and leave pets behind, others stay away for more than 12 hours, some dogs are not housebroken, not exercised properly and stress will make them bark etc, charge more for pets, people that really love them will pay, if you are animal lover you can always refund if the person turns out to be responsible, 

-Everyone is clean and professional, place in writing all the minuscule detail what clean means, from trash to dirty dishes, AS SAD AS IT IS you may have to spell out in the contract what clean means, real time cleaning, and some people don't know how to clean, get it of these people if you care about descent clean environment (not OCD), they will always be trouble even if they clean.

-Draw a very detailed contract and provisions dictating different fee structure if person is late, brings visitor more than x numbers days per month, if they are late more than x number times with rent., the best way of doing it is if you want $800 a month, do the contract for $1,100 and the tenant/roommate will get a discount if  rent will be $800 if all provisions respected, so basically you are not raising the rent, but charging the actual value, but be honest about, do not overreact for any little minor issue, warning usually is the best approach.

-out of state people are the worse, no history, hard to verify, be extra careful, better check how many addresses they had for the last 3 years.

-people that  go around bad mouthing the world and making themselves victims of everything and everyone, no brainier, stay away
Most important 2 months security deposit, people that don't have a least 3 months of rent are irresponsible or live beyond their means, again there are exceptions out there, but do you want to risk since the exception  might be less than 10%?

-never forgive late payment unless, except if one year has passed and the person was never late, one time forgiveness only. 
-there are online services that will do background including eviction history  search for landlords and  roommates, you can charge $30, if the person has nothing to worry won't mind paying $30 or you do yourself, $30 is better than the potential hassle

The truth is, people always have excuse to do you wrong, you will never come across people giving you excuse for paying before the due date or for more than their fair share. 

Don't forget to be a good roommate or landlord, it is a two way street, spell out what you want and make people sign, yet do not twist things around just because you can, it can back fire on your face.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hi! I am a 32 year old professional and own a house and work in the DC metro area. I love NYC, am there frequently, and am looking for a part time place to stay for the weekends (either late Thursday night or Friday afternoon through the weekend leaving Monday afternoon) in Manhattan only, preferably close to midtown. 

I am ideally looking for a furnished space (if not I would be happy to bring an air mattress), and since it is only part time, I am looking for ~$500/mo.  I would likely need the ability to telework from this location on either Fridays and/or Mondays. 

I currently have this exact arrangement through the end of June in a lovely location in Chelsea and would be happy to meet with you on one of the weekends that I am in town to see if we would be compatible roommates.  If that works out, I would be happy to ask my current roommate to provide reference to how my current arrangement has gone for us, upon your request. 

I am super friendly, and will likely be out and about most of the time. I will likely rarely use the kitchen - I love going out to eat, which is partly why I love being in New York on the weekends.  If you like food as much as I do, we will probably get along (I am always looking for new food friends)! I rarely, if ever, drink. I am open to socializing and love making new friends.   I don't smoke or have pets. I am very respectful and dependable, I have a good job, and I am extremely responsible. 

This would be a great arrangement if you have a unique situation (need a part time tenant/are in another city for the weekends/looking for a little extra cash etc.)!

Since I already have this arrangement through the end of June, I would be looking to start around the first weekend of July and am flexible on start timing. Also, since I have a home in DC, if there are weekends you need the space (have family/guests in town etc.) I can be flexible.  

Happy to provide any additional info you may be wondering about via email or in person. I look forward to hearing from you!
title: 32F - Part Time Housing Only - July 1 - Weekends only (Fri-Mon) - $500

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hi! I'm a professional worker with a full-time job in the tech industry, and I'm looking for a room to move into at the end of May.

First, a little about myself. In terms of personality, I'm an introvert, and I can also be shy at times. I usually do stay home to recharge after going out.

I am respectful, clean/hygienic, responsible, friendly, and I do not smoke (though I'm 420-friendly). I look for the same qualities in prospective roommates. Also, I'm totally down to play board or videogames, if you're into those :)

I'm more of a night owl, and I currently work from 4PM to midnight Monday through Friday (including some days from home).

Enough about me! Here are the requirements I'm looking for in an apartment (in no particular order, and I can be flexible on some for the right place):
* in NYC
* $700-$1100/month (ideally including utilities, and I'll pay no more than 1st month and 1 month security up-front)
* no broker fee
* safe neighborhood (i.e., you'd be fine with your own daughter walking home from the train after midnight)
* ground floor (or has an elevator)
* unfurnished bedroom comfortably fits king bed (10' x 12' minimum)
* quiet environment (e.g., minimal noise from neighbors, planes, trains, automobiles, animals, banging radiators, etc.)
* reliable high-speed Internet
* 3- to 5-month lease permitted (ideally with month-to-month option afterward)
* great mobile carrier quality in the bedroom (T-Mobile, US Cellular, or Sprint)
* LGBT-friendly residence
* laundry machines within unit/building/1 short block (250 ft.)
* if you cook meat or seafood, you're ok using fans, open windows, candles, etc.
* electronic payment accepted for rent and utilities (Zelle, Paypal, Google Wallet, etc.)
* within 2 long blocks (1400 ft.) of a subway stop
* ~30 minutes to Tribeca
* no more than 3 people to a bathroom
* overnight guests permitted (mostly on weekends, not anything crazy)

For some of these, there may be some wiggle room. And before you balk at my requirements, know that I've lived in 4 apartments so far that met all (or most) of these, so I know they're out there!

I'm looking to move at the end of May. I'm a bit flexible with the exact date, but ideally within the second half of the month.

Please contact me only if you have a room that satisfies all of these requirements to some degree. Please be up-front about which requirements are not fully met so no one's time is wasted. And please provide at least 2 pictures of the room itself, as well as at least one picture of each common room (kitchen, living room, etc.).

Additionally, please let me know what led to the room's vacancy (if there was an occupant here previously, is there any particular reason why they left that I should know about)?

Thanks for reading, and do feel free to ask me questions, of course :)

Updated 1-Bed/1- Bath in the up-and-coming Heights Section of Jersey City, available starting June 1st. This is a shared living space as the 1-Bed/1- Bath is dedicated to you but within a 2-Bed/2-Bath apartment. The unit is located right next to the intersection of Palisades Ave. and Wood Place (exact address to be provided only for serious inquiries). 

The unit features updated floors, an updated kitchen, exposed brick, and amazing access to NYC! This unit is only 1.3 miles away from the Hoboken Path Station, 1.5 miles away from the Journal Square Path Station, and the nearest bus stop is in front of the building for a 25min ride to Times Square. 

Across the street is a grocery store and only one block away is a new coffee shop, bar, and pizza place. This is a 4th floor walk-up in a 15 unit building. Laundry is also located in the building. 

The apartment will be shared with myself. I am a late 20's straight male professional that is typically at work from Mon-Sat 9a-9p. When I am not in work or at home I am trying to spend time outdoors. I work in marketing/e-comm/start-ups and am very laid back & courteous. 

I am looking for a 20's - 40's professional who is respectful, clean, and neat. Someone who understands balance, is light-hearted, and doesn't bring the party home (often). It would be great if we can share a drink, conversation, or a run together but don't need to be besties. 

Rent: 

One year lease - unfurnished (6/1/18 - 6/1/19): $1,600/month
One year lease - furnished (6/1/18 - 6/1/19): $1,650/month
6 month lease - unfurnished: $1,700/month
6 month lease - furnished: $1,750/month

One month's rent required at signing for a deposit. 
Reference and credit checks required. 


Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: !!!MY DREAM FOR YOUR NEW YORK~~~~~~~~~

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
If you want to move to New York City from another state, then fine. The way to do this is to find a job where you live and save up money to move.

Many young people here think someone in NYC can host them for free, for a few months, while they look for a job? No. No one can afford that. This is a roommate or rental site. People who have a room need to charge MARKET RATE, because their landlord is charging THEM market rate.

So if you have a dream to move to NYC that's great. Save your money and move here. Sure some people can move here in college, they have rich parents and can prove it with bank statements. It's expensive to live here. Don't expect to move here with no money.

PLEASE, PLEASE do not come here to go to private college and take out enormous student loans for tuition and rent in Manhattan! If you DO decide to go to school here, NO ONE has to live a 5 minute walk to school. You DON'T have to live in the Village, Upper East Side or Upper West Side. Make do with a Metrocard and commute from Queens or whatever borough. This student loan debt to pay Manhattan rent is SICK.

If you are looking to "barter" for no money, please list your ad under "barters". Not this section.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Most singles looking for roommates want OTHER SINGLES. Not couples. Reason is simple. Why share the bathroom and kitchen with 2 people, when you can share with one? Most 2 bedroom and 3 bedroom apts have ONE bathroom! No these apts weren't meant for 3 couples of 6 adults and it's illegal against fire code besides. 

Couples feel they're entitled to have a second person to live for free. No for your information, if you are part of a couple, you MIGHT get a room by paying EXTRA for the extra roommate! Novel idea huh?

Most likely, you won't have any luck getting a couple, "buy one, get one free" room. Your best bet is looking for a studio. Or looking in a much less desirable hard to fill area.

Ok a studio can run you $1350-$1500/mo in Queens. Much less in Staten Island, about $1000 (but you might need a car). Less in the Bronx, maybe a studio for about $1100? Cost more in Brooklyn. Manhattan studios start at $2000, so I guess you can't walk to work! You must pay first, last months security and one months brokers fee. Nothing in your budget is "walkable" or "30 minute commute".  or 2 blocks to the subway! Try an hour. Don't know about the interns that want a place for a few months. Probably they can just stay home.

Or move to NJ. Look in Newport, it's near a Mall.

Last week I saw an ad for 3 adults and 2 dogs who want to squeeze into ONE ROOM to save for an apt! Uh NO! That's against the fire codes and cause for eviction!
title: There is NO Pay for One get One FREE: ROOM 4 COUPLES!!! $800

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Please take note out of towners! There is NO neighborhood in Manhattan that has a room for rent for $800/mo! Be realistic and research the going rates on the internet! Yikes, for 20 somethings you certainly aren't internet savvy!

If you can't afford the rents here, Do NOT come here. Anyone who is looking for a roommate cannot afford to do you a favor. No one is willing to pay 75% of the rent, so you can pay 25%. Grow up!

Try to be realistic about the apt. No millionaire is renting out rooms. There is no private extra bathroom. Yes you might have to walk up. A private entrance is called a studio apt. And no one has "extra" rooms. You're lucky to get ANYTHING! Demand exceeds supply!

And yes you will have to take the subway. Count on a one hour commute average. Each way. No one walks to school or work.

$800/month for a room in the Bronx, more in Queens and Brooklyn, MUCH more in Manhattan.

Yes we are all struggling and juggling here. A listing of all YOUR many requirements is unwanted and insulting to all of us who struggle to live here.
title: There is NO Room for rent downtown W Village $800

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
This is NY not Palm Springs. The whole place is in a constant state of disrepair. The roads are a mess, the whole state smells of farts yet we somehow block it out with selective odor perception. A decent chunk of properties out there haven't been updated since Josh Hartnett was steadily receiving roles yet $2,100 a month still isn't enough for a ONE bedroom apartment in Nassau county. How is this possible?

I'm 50% of a stable, functioning unit. AKA married, both in professional careers that we went to school to become qualified to do. Credit scores over 700, no criminal record, no evictions, never late on rent yet for some god forsaken reason we are destined to remain in this apartment complex that uses the word 'Luxury' in its title for nothing other than a cruel inside joke as in once you're inside, you get the joke...And it's not funny. Today I went to get the mail and saw a guy that looked like a fat Willy Nelson outside in his underwear. He seemed busy so I didn't say hello.

We don't ask for much. Nassau County. A BY OWNER listing (no brokers).  No basements-- Anyone who can with complete and utter confidence ask a person to pay more than $2,000 to live underground like a gopher in a basement has to take a moment and reconsider their lives. A washer/dryer would be ace! I like clean clothes and being able to get them from the dryer to the closet without having to worry about falling on the ice whilst holding the bag. A bedroom, also amazing! A kitchen you can fit more than one person in. A bath tub. It would be convenient to have a front door that leads to outside and not a dark, narrow stairwell leading to the front door. No bells or whistles, really. Just a place you can come home to after a long day, sigh and think 'I'm home' and kick your feet up with a cup of tea and watch some netflix or read a book.
title: How is it that $2,100 is NOT enough for a measley 1 bedroom?!
