body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
So many people want to barter housekeeping for a private room! This must be very common in other parts of the country. It is NOT welcome in NYC. The real estate prices here are VERY HIGH. They are also in HIGH DEMAND. Any one with a separate room has their choice of many people wanting the room for MARKET RATE. A housekeeping job is part time, a few hours a week and pays minimum wage. It does not equal the rent for a room in an apt here.

Out of Towners looking for a free bartered room usually demand Manhattan! It's a $2000/month room and your housekeeping skills aren't worth that much! Then you want furnishings, free internet and utilities! And some ask for a private apt!

Anyone looking for a roommate is not saying "Hey! Why don't I just get a free housekeeper instead!!!" Anyone looking for a professional maid goes to an agency, not Craigslist. It's a low wage job, unless you are working for the Trumps or Clintons.

And then you have ALL THESE REQUIREMENTS FOR YOUR FREE ROOM! What a joke! Like "No Cooking, just errand running! No babysitting!" Please just stay home if you can't afford to pay rent!
title: We cannot barter housekeeping for FREE private room

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Attention out of towners! Landlords are not looking on Craiglist for "cheap" renters to fill their apts! There are 10 people in a day who want to rent an apt!

If you want an apt in NYC you really must go to a broker. Sometimes they will have no-fee apts. Unless you know someone who has a vacancy in their building, then this is the way it is done. You might get lucky and find one in a million on the internet, but more likely you will be sleeping on the subway. You will mostly have no luck posting on here and begging for a no broker "cheap" apt. It's a crapshoot. Is that what you want?

No I don't work for a real estate company. but plenty of times I have rented out my apt and I put up an ad on CL getting TONS of replies in one day. Landlords can pick and choose. There are no "cheap" or "reasonable" apts.

Much more sensible to get your own apt and then advertise for your own roommate. Yeah, obviously it's cheaper to have your roommate pay all the fees and furnish the place too. Then you want 2 people to split the room!!! Why would anyone take 2 people to share the bathroom and kitchen when they can have one? Some posters even want 4 people to squeeze into a room while they save for an apt!!! Or 3 adults and 2 huge dogs for $200/mo!!! This is illegal and against FDNY laws. This is cause for eviction.

You really have to research what apts are going for and divide that by the amount of bedrooms. Finances are all math. If you are listing a BELOW MARKET price for "room wanted" don't be shocked if you get no real responses. Fingers crossed won't do it. I have time to write educational posts, but MOST PEOPLE ARE WAY TOO BUSY TO STRAIGHTEN YOU OUT. And by the way, in Manhattan space is very expensive. No one has extra empty rooms that they can rent out for a lowball price. Millionaires are not looking for roommates.

Yesterday someone wants to rent a room for 7 cats! Huh?

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We would like to exchange our house for one in Brooklyn. 

- Ideally Park Slope or Williamsburg, but open to other areas.
- The swap would need to be for two weeks between July 30th and August 18th (preferably the first two weeks)
- Ideally a full house or large apartment, with at least 3 bedrooms, kids friendly

Our house is an ideal family home with a pool, 15 minutes from the City Centre. It is a recently built 3 stories high house (plus basement) with a terrace and a small swimming pool in a relaxed area of the City.

The house fits 8 people comfortably. The main bedroom is on the first floor and is perfect for a couple, with an extra large bed, full bathroom and dressing room and direct access to a spacious and bright office for two.

The other 3 rooms are on the second floor. They are all the same size and with a full set of wardrobes each, with access to two full bathrooms (one with a shower, the other one with a bathtub). One has a large bed for two, another one has an individual bed (and could fit an additional mattress or extra bed if need be) and the last one has two individual beds plus a small sofa-bed for a kid or a toddler, which could be placed elsewhere.

The house sports a fantastic and spacious living room/dining room with a high ceiling and surrounded in its entirety by large windows that lead to the terrace, all with automatic shutters and blinds so that you can control the amount of light you want from the outside. The living room also has a huge 3 meter wide projector screen and home cinema system!

The terrace has wooden floors and is surrounded by beautiful and carefully selected plants, has a small patch of grass and a small (5.5m x 2m) swimming pool perfect to cool down in hot Madrid summer days. The pool can also be covered and thus the terrace gets expanded.

The kitchen is connected to the terrace, which is perfect when you want to eat or dine outside and very convenient whenever you want to prepare a BBQ. It has a large fridge, dishwasher, oven, microwave, toaster, etc.

The basement floor has a playing room with a big and comfy sofa, which is perfect for kids.

It is close to Arturo Soria, which has all the niceties of a very residential area without having to leave the City. It is an a particularly quiet area, so absolutely no noise at night. It is at a walking distance from three really nice restaurants, a mall with additional places to eat as well as shops, supermarkets, etc.

It is exceptionally well connected. Literally a few minutes walk away from an underground station and equally close to 3 bus lines towards the center. It is also minutes away from the M-30 (the smallest ring highway that surrounds Madrid through which you can pretty much drive anywhere in town) and has good access to the M-40 (the second ring around Madrid)

Getting to and from the airport couldn't be easier by Taxi (20€ ride) or Underground (20 minutes).
title: August 2018 swap. Amazing house in Madrid-Spain for house in Brooklyn

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Take to the skies above Manhattan at Midtown Penthouse. Set among the clouds on the 77th floor, this luxury New York City vacation rental affords views of Central Park, the George Washington Bridge and even the planes taking off from LaGuardia. The views inside are just as stunning, thanks to luxe finishes and custom-designed pieces, and the 2 bedrooms and world-class amenities make for a pampering adults-only holiday.

Your stay at Midtown Penthouse includes access to the building's 10,000-square-foot spa and health club, 60-foot pool and private garden. If you've driven to New York, leave your car with the valet, and if you need assistance with reservations or tickets, the 24/7 concierge will be happy to help. Thanks to a recent renovation, the lights, music, video, climate and even the shades in the penthouse can all be controlled through a smart-home system with the touch of a button on your smartphone or tablet.

Soaring ceilings and huge windows flood the villa's interiors with light, and thoughtful decor by DGD Group Design lends a fresh, modern appeal. The great room's white-oak herringbone floors are an elegant yet understated backdrop for a sleek white sectional, low-slung leather settee and Missoni pouf in the sitting area, mod grey chairs and a geometric area rug in the dining area, and crisp white Caesarstone counters and high-end appliances in the state-of-the-art Pedini kitchen.

Each of the two bedrooms at Midtown Penthouse faces east, letting in morning light and gorgeous river views, and features walnut closets custom-made in Italy by Pianca. There are two bedrooms with king beds and en-suite , and one bedroom with a queen bed bathroom.

The villa's location in Midtown East puts you at the heart of the city, close to both family favorites such as Central Park, the Empire State Building and Broadway, and the after-dark attractions of Times Square and the Lincoln Center. Shop the tempting windows of nearby Fifth Avenue, catch the latest exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art or spend an afternoon with an icon at the Statue of Liberty. When it's time to leave, plan on an 8-mile trip to LaGuardia Airport or a 13-mile trip to John F. Kennedy International Airport.

Address 330 East 38th Street New York, NY 10016
title: luxury New York City vacation rental affords views of Central Park

Having an understanding of your homes metrics is crucial in order to properly and confidently diagnose a reccomended repair. Most problems are mistakenly diagnosed due to a lack of EXPERIENCE and a BASIC understanding of your homes METRICS. I offer reliable sound Service. I am obsessed with home performance and the effectiveness of your HVAC'S ability to function properly. Occupancy health is another phrase that will soon become popular. The HEALTH of the OCCUPANTS is huge. 
A system's failure has a SPECIFIC cause. If you're looking for a half baked quick fix, we are not the company to call. We will find the WHY the error has occurred and do our professional best to prevent the same in the future. We offer over 3 Generations of experience backed by an occupancy forensics mentality. Meaning, We are concentrating on the indoor metrics of your home. We call this practice, Residential / Building Performance Forensics. The ability to understand what your homes metrics tell us what we act on, not on what was achieved in the last home. We believe that every home's environment is unique and must be addressed as such. Replacing the obvious part is temporary! We diagnose to component level and we EDUCATE. No guesses, No assumptions, here! I am aware of many in this industry who make it very difficult for the serious professional to be effective. I understand and treat every opportunity as if it were the last. My expertise in this industry I can assure is UNMATCHED! We are currently offering a SPRING/SUMMER Preventative Maintenance Special. I am not talking about a system inspection, I am offering a complete systematic equipment evaluation and servicing. All service repairs are videoed for quality and training purposes, and for perfecting our skills. You can request otherwise if need be. Please call and schedule your SUMMER MAINTENANCE special today while offer is valid. OUR SERVICES ARE IN HIGH DEMAND.. WE WILL ONLY ADVERTISE THIS OFFER FOR A SHORT PERIOD IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO MAINTAIN OUR FANTASTIC CUSTOMER BASE!

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Looking for a 1-year lease from a PRIVATE OWNER beginning July 1st. 

I just recently moved to New York from Boston (I've lived here previously), and my partner will be joining me here in early July after his work contract in Boston finishes. We are both working professionals in our mid-20's, extremely clean and quiet. In other words, we don't throw parties.

We are ideally seeking a 1 or 2 bedroom place and our checklist is fairly particular. Non-negotiables are the following:

- Washer/Dryer In-Unit (must be in-unit, not just in the building)
- All standard kitchen appliances in good working order, including dishwasher
- Unit cannot be on ground floor (top floor in a smaller building is most ideal)
- Within 2-3 blocks of a subway station
- Street parking available nearby

We only rent from private owners because their spaces tend to be maintained better. Currently, we do not have a pet, but a pet-friendly policy would be a bonus (but not a deal breaker). We also tend to prefer smaller buildings over larger ones.

Our budget is flexible between $2200 - $2800/month. Plenty of references from current/former landlords available as needed.

Ideal neighborhoods include Red Hook, Carroll Gardens, Cobble Hill, Brooklyn Heights. Willing to look elsewhere but I work in Midtown Manhattan so not much further out than the neighborhoods listed above.

Please do not contact me if you are an agent/broker. Private owners only. Thank you!

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
This is my last resort so I see no other option but to try this. I am a stranded Dutch tourist looking for a place to stay for the night (and if possible more, but that's entirely up to you). I got robbed from all my documents and money. In one of the not so good parts of New York. I was naive, walking to my hotel and somebody robbed me at gunpoint yesterday. I need some days to sort things out and I absolutely do not wish to sleep on the street or in a homeless shelter. Just the thought alone frightens me. I have a job (I work from the computer) and enough money for food handy to make it through the week. All I need is a place where I can lay down my head and where I'm not exposed to danger. I have no direct family or friends who could help me. I want to go back to Europe as soon as possible. Who is willing to help? Even suggestions would help me out a lot. I am not a local and therefore I don't know what I could possibly do. I visited the embassy and applied for an emergency passport. I've found a church who is willing to receive mail and therefore I will have my debit card within a week, and finally acces to my bank account again. I went to hotels and asked for a place to stay, with my passport as a deposit, and a promise I would pay them back upcoming Monday. Unfortunately, which I fully understand, they do not consider this to be an option. I'm looking forward to your ideas/suggestions and many thanks in advance! I ask you kindly, please no sexual or illegal offers. I am a 25 y/o white male. I don't use drugs, I am educated and employed, I don't smoke and I don't drink.
title: Stranded European tourist looking for help/suggestions. Please read :)

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
(Jersey City, The Heights, Hoboken, Bayonne, Hoboken, Union City, Journal Square, Hamilton Park, Weehawken, Union City, Secaucus, West New York, Guttenberg, Fairview, Ridgefield, North Bergen, Cliffside Park, Edgewater, Ridgefield, Palisades Park, Fort Lee, etc.)

I'm looking for a place where I can SLEEP OUTSIDE!  Yes, you heard that right.  I have indoor allergies and greatly benefit from fresh air at night to revitalize. Just opening a window in my room isn't as effective.  It's important that the place is Modern or Renovated and there is No Smoking or Burning Incense inside.  Pets are usually fine, I've lived with many.  Also the outside area (yard, terrace, patio, porch, deck) should be somewhat private.

Think no one rents out a tent in their yard? ...especially not in the city. Think again: 
Try searching for this in your browser: "Mountain View Man Renting Small Tent".
Or search for "Tents in Los Angeles Airbnb" (find the link with that title in the results)

I'm not looking for some kind of cheaper deal on rent here.  Actually, I have typically paid more than those just paying for a room for this type of setup.  Yes, I've done this before and yes all year around, for the last 5 years actually. It is legal to the best of my knowledge, I've researched it and spoken with attorneys about it. 

I have a small walk-in closet size bit of belongings so I will need space for these inside as well (Small Room, Shared Room, Den, or Walk-in Closet) and normal use of your common areas. 

ABOUT ME: Single non-smoking male, straight, 40's, software engineer, very clean, no drugs, no kids, no pets, no parties, no guests, & no drama.  Originally from Michigan.

I have a 16 unit B&B in the beautiful city of Fortaleza, blessed with the best climate in Brazil. I am 70 years old & retiring. Perfect for a couple. Heart of downtown with view of the ocean. It's an easy walk of 1 block to beach, nightlife, museums, theaters, banks, restaurants, shopping. Half of the units have kitchens. We have a pool, garage, BBQ, deck, garden & laundry on site. Airport has easy direct flights to Miami & Orlando daily. Neighborhood is mostly high rise apartments and hotels. Perfect location to add a restaurant if desired. Staff of 3, not including myself. It's known for friendly people, breathtaking beaches, great seafood plus it's always summer! I commute back and forth from NYC. I have been operating in Fortaleza since 1994.  email me any questions you may have. James

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Me: Been looking for awhile now. You may have seen my ad. It's not that I'm really picky. Just a little common sense. I'm open to any area in the city. I'm well educated and probably will get along better with other like-minded peeps who value education. As attractive and total package as I am, I'm not looking for a hook-up so more than one roomie will probably be better too. 

Here's what will waste your time and mine. I'm not looking to share your bed or live in your basement. It may very well be an awesome space, however, I'm not interested in living in a cave, without light or windows or trees. I'm not looking to go to another site so please no other links. I'm an ethical individual and appreciate other trustworthy folks. I'm not looking to share the costs exactly and you can have a pet but no other pets are welcome. Let's play fair. By the way, I don't have any pets yet I'm pet friendly. I don't smoke either tobacco or cannabis but I'm 420 friendly. I'm not gay and I support the LGBT community. I have no plants yet I love flowers and trees. Go figure. If you think for a moment that no overnight guests are welcome, no thank you. While I rarely drink, don't party or bring the party home, I do value good friends and family and welcome their company. I may on occasion have an out of town guest visit briefly. I do travel often so I probably won't even be around that much. When I am, I promise someone who is considerate, responsible and funny. My references will attest to that. Since I travel often, I'm not interested in renting a whole place by myself but rather a room within a respectful home and a place that I look forward to being a part of.

title: 1 bed room apartment wanted

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Most singles looking for roommates want OTHER SINGLES. Not couples. Reason is simple. Why share the bathroom and kitchen with 2 people, when you can share with one? Most 2 bedroom and 3 bedroom apts have ONE bathroom! No these apts weren't meant for 3 couples of 6 adults and it's illegal against fire code besides. 

Couples feel they're entitled to have a second person to live for free. No for your information, if you are part of a couple, you MIGHT get a room by paying EXTRA for the extra roommate! Novel idea huh?

Most likely, you won't have any luck getting a couple, "buy one, get one free" room. Your best bet is looking for a studio. Or looking in a much less desirable hard to fill area.

Ok a studio can run you $1350-$1500/mo in Queens. Much less in Staten Island, about $1000 (but you might need a car). Less in the Bronx, maybe a studio for about $1100? Cost more in Brooklyn. Manhattan studios start at $2000, so I guess you can't walk to work! You must pay first, last months security and one months brokers fee. Nothing in your budget is "walkable" or "30 minute commute".  or 2 blocks to the subway! Try an hour. Don't know about the interns that want a place for a few months. Probably they can just stay home.

Or move to NJ. Look in Newport, it's near a Mall.

Last week I saw an ad for 3 adults and 2 dogs who want to squeeze into ONE ROOM to save for an apt! Uh NO! That's against the fire codes and cause for eviction!
title: There is NO Pay for One get One FREE: ROOM 4 COUPLES!!! $800

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Please take note out of towners! There is NO neighborhood in Manhattan that has a room for rent for $800/mo! Be realistic and research the going rates on the internet! Yikes, for 20 somethings you certainly aren't internet savvy!

If you can't afford the rents here, Do NOT come here. Anyone who is looking for a roommate cannot afford to do you a favor. No one is willing to pay 75% of the rent, so you can pay 25%. Grow up!

Try to be realistic about the apt. No millionaire is renting out rooms. There is no private extra bathroom. Yes you might have to walk up. A private entrance is called a studio apt. And no one has "extra" rooms. You're lucky to get ANYTHING! Demand exceeds supply!

And yes you will have to take the subway. Count on a one hour commute average. Each way. No one walks to school or work.

$800/month for a room in the Bronx, more in Queens and Brooklyn, MUCH more in Manhattan.

Yes we are all struggling and juggling here. A listing of all YOUR many requirements is unwanted and insulting to all of us who struggle to live here.
title: There is NO Room for rent downtown W Village $800

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Attention out of towners! Landlords are not looking on Craiglist for "cheap" renters to fill their apts! There are 10 people in a day who want to rent an apt!

If you want an apt in NYC you really must go to a broker. Sometimes they will have no-fee apts. Unless you know someone who has a vacancy in their building, then this is the way it is done. You might get lucky and find one in a million on the internet, but more likely you will be sleeping on the subway. You will mostly have no luck posting on here and begging for a no broker "cheap" apt. It's a crapshoot. Is that what you want?

No I don't work for a real estate company. but plenty of times I have rented out my apt and I put up an ad on CL getting TONS of replies in one day. Landlords can pick and choose. There are no "cheap" or "reasonable" apts.

Much more sensible to get your own apt and then advertise for your own roommate. Yeah, obviously it's cheaper to have your roommate pay all the fees and furnish the place too. Then you want 2 people to split the room!!! Why would anyone take 2 people to share the bathroom and kitchen when they can have one? Some posters even want 4 people to squeeze into a room while they save for an apt!!! Or 3 adults and 2 huge dogs for $200/mo!!! This is illegal and against FDNY laws. This is cause for eviction.

You really have to research what apts are going for and divide that by the amount of bedrooms. Finances are all math. If you are listing a BELOW MARKET price for "room wanted" don't be shocked if you get no real responses. Fingers crossed won't do it. I have time to write educational posts, but MOST PEOPLE ARE WAY TOO BUSY TO STRAIGHTEN YOU OUT. And by the way, in Manhattan space is very expensive. No one has extra empty rooms that they can rent out for a lowball price. Millionaires are not looking for roommates.

Yesterday someone wants to rent a room for 7 cats! Huh?

furnished 
townhouse

Gorgeous 3 bedroom duplex in historic renovated Stuy Heights townhouse / 2 floors all to yourself / 2 bathrooms 
Newly renovated w/ attention to details
Will come furnished
We are an architect and contractor husband and wife couple looking to sublet our beautiful home to the right person or family for 1 month this summer. Dates and times can be flexible for the right people.

SUBWAY
We are a 5 minute walk to the Utica stop on the A Train Express which is only 20 minutes to Fulton street.

THE APARTMENT
On the Parlor floor there is a new kitchen, a full bathroom and a spacious living room. The front room on the parlor fl can be used as a bedroom, office, dining room, or an additional living room. (The photos show it set up as a bedroom and dining room).

On the garden fl there are 2 oversized bedrooms a full master bath suite w soaking tub, a separate toilet room, laundry and wood paneled hallway.

Access to the yard is through the master bedroom.

We spend a lot of time just hanging out on the L shaped exterior stoop (stairs) in the warmer weather.

The bedrooms have newly installed central AC and the parlor floor has a window unit. 

Finishes include Japanese style bath and tub fixtures, imported Japanese tile, and a cararra marble countertop and backsplash at the kitchen. Bertazoni range. Toto heated toilet seat w bidet. 

Beautiful hardwood floors with an oil monocoat finish and tons of closet space.

ARCHITECTURE
On the parlor there is original parlor floor woodwork and trim on the windows, original shutters, cove molding.
The building is a historic four story 19' wide town house on a landmarked block. This Queen Anne style townhouse was built in 1889 by John Taaffe and designed by the architect J. G. Glover. The architecture on stuyvesant ave is top notch

NEIGHBORHOOD
All the best of bed Stuy is right outside your door step!

Georges Andres is like having a second living right outside your doorstep. The place is amazing, the vibe is incredible, super kid friendly, the best cappuccinos in brooklyn (I think so?), authentic Parisian crepes prepared by Superfrench on the weekends, and they just got their liquor license 🍷!

Down the block from Saraghina. Simply put they are the best! They made it into the Michelin Guide book. https://www.viamichelin.com/web/Restaurant/Brooklyn-11233-Saraghina-2v3eye9f
I judge a NYC restaurant on consistency and they deliver consistently every time for the 6 years I have been going there. Always improving and getting better. A true brooklyn dining experience.

Saraghina Bakery bakes their own baguettes, bread and pastry and is top notch. Not to mention a killer selection of imported cheese!

There is also Bar Lunatico down the block which always seems to have amazing live music and performances.

Not to mention L'Antangoniste, Mama Fox Just opened, Casablanca and Peaches. 

Also super close to 3 playgrounds, supermarket, and lots of other stuff, other cafes, record store, yoga studios, vintage clothing store, brooklyn public library.

Heat, water, hot water, internet, electricity and gas included

Showing available upon request

We have a cat 

$4500/mo

$4500/security fee / negotiable

No broker fee

We are looking for a 1 month sublet this summer 
Exact dates can be flexible 

Would also be interested in a house trade / house swap possible
Interested in Hamptons / Montauk / Hudson Valley / Berkshires / Adirondacks / Catskills / New Hampshire / Vermont / PA / Putnam county / dutchess county / lake property or lake house / lake candlewood / Connecticut / Massachusetts

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Locations: northern Stamford, CT
Agency: WZ Education Group
Hosting Length: remainder of 2017-2018 school-year, with potential for renewal next school-year

WZ Education Group is seeking responsible, safe, and engaging families in the Stamford, CT area to host an international student going to Trinity Catholic High School. The primary language spoken in the home should be English, since the student is attending an English-speaking school. (Though bilingual families can give a student the chance to learn more language and more culture!) The student will need lodging, meals, and transportation to and from school, and will need the limited legal guardianship of the host family.
Each of our interested homestays fills out a homestay application, which includes pictures of rooms for student use and information about the household.

We are looking for households which can provide: 
-- 1 bedroom for student use (private rooms are strongly preferred)
-- 1 bathroom for student use (may be shared with children of similar age and gender)
-- 3 nutritious meals per day, or equivalent (packed lunch, or school lunch program, etc.)
-- A welcoming, safe environment
-- Transportation to and from school daily, and for school events (sports, clubs, etc.)
-- Adherence to strong ethical behavior
Each legal adult in the home must be able to pass a background check.

If you would like to be one of our homestays, we need to stay in touch through:
-- a landline or home phone number
-- emergency contact information
-- an email address that is checked regularly (several times per week)
-- signing of a host family agreement with WZ Group

To cover student expenses and to ensure student comfort, WZ Group offers host families a competitive monthly stipend, dependent on quality of furnishings and convenience for the student. 
Homestays must be available to be contacted by the international student or WZ Group management 24 hours a day during the students stay, in case of emergency or other extreme situation.
title: Host Families Needed Near Trinity Catholic High School

Bad things happen to good people. I have been homeless for two months due to the end of a relationship, and while it is a laughing matter (all things are) , I could use some help. I have references. I am neat and tidy. I don't require much space. Im 420 friendly but I can keep it out of your home. Im a non smoker. Im 47 and Im willing to trade cleaning /pet grooming/childcare services for place to live. I have managed to maintain one client while homeless so I am not wholly unemployed but I could use a break on the first month rent. In exchange you get a rational, very chill, connected roommate/tenent who can most likely make up for the first month rent after getting back on my feet. Im tired of using my computer for a pillow and filching complimentary coffee from hotel lobbies. I have a lot going for me and with your help I can make that snowball. Please extend an olive branch. I m worth the investment of time and money. Thank you so much for reading this. So far I have managed not to appear or smell homeless ...

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
I'm currently in the NYC area. I am an older female, not a kid. I have one pet, an older well behaved cat. I have a strong managerial, sales, and office background. I have also taken care of children and done a lot of elder care. I would like to work a certain # of hours in exchange for housing doing office or graphics work. (Anything above that I will likely also gladly work if we can agree on a set rate of pay, situation, etc.) I can also sit kids or animals, have done both, though the kids it's been a very long time. I do have a friend and ex-manager who can vouch for me. I am extremely responsible and trustworthy. Yes, this is a real person asking, not some kind of CL flake thing. 

Can you help? Hook me up with decent situation? Do you need help? Lately my charges have had dentures. I'm kind of ready for fun and games, museums, playing in the parks and stuff like that. I miss that. I did have CPR back then but I would have to recertify now. I've also done cooking for older folks a lot. I'm a good cook or so I am told. I can cook just about any cuisine there is usually. I don't want to be a f/t housekeeper. I'm going to say that up front but I'm very open to a lot of things otherwise so long as it is legit. 

I am looking for a LEGITIMATE barter/work position. Not a FWB thing. I am being polite. Generally speaking I always answer emails and am very professional about it, but I am not here to be abused and I won't answer any emails about a situation like that. 
I am looking for something long term and stable. I'm trying very hard to stay in the city, at least within a decent subway ride of Manhattan. I don't need to live right in it but I do like to go in and do photography, museums when I am off. I would prefer a live in but living out might be possible if I can get a room in the area that I can afford. In that case I would definitely expect a regular salary. I'm looking for a job with a place to live but it's not 100% non-negotiable that it not be live out. 

TY

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
I am looking for room rent for preferably  $500 - willing to negotiate. 

ATTENTION: I'm not desperate, I understand that is a low price. I'm simply a student in transition that took some time off to caretake for a family member. I am willing to negotiate FINANCIALLY OR PROFESSIONALLY.  DO NOT REPLY LOOKING FOR A COMPANION OR GIRLFRIEND. 

I am a business student and first time move into NY to be near family.

Currently upgrading my major from Business Managament to Science in Business - currently enrolled.

I am a certified personal trainer by both NASM and ACE (high reputable).

I have had roommates for 8 years and grown up with refugees so I understand and respect others properties. 
I am a free and happy spirit open to positive/progressive comunication.

I do not work well with people carrying work baggage, drug addicts, shady, and are negative. Please do not contact me because I am a trainer I will not be your live in coach. I'm not judgementmental as long as whatever it is does not effect me or disrepect me. I come from a laid back and indigenous culture. I get along pretty well with people that are upfront and try their honest best to be a good humam. 

I love music, guitar, sewing, active living, reading, and preserving my energy towards positivity. I'm pretty well travelled so I can respect other cultures and be empathetic. Some people know me as funny, hard working, and optimistic. 

I like to keep my class and respect, although please dont mistake my kindness for weakness. 
I have a professional background as dedicated trainer and promotional specialist/sales/assistant striving towards quality and longevity. 

I don't wish to have a companion roommate although I will respect you as a human as should everyone. 
I am huge fan of John Lennon's philosphy and was raised from scratch.

My school and health is important to me. I will be sure to pay my rent on time I have references if needed.
If you would like to barter training I can do that as well. I am a nationally accredited trainer and 3 x international athlete. 

My aim is a safe and happy environment where I can focus on my online classes , tutor at the school, and flexible schedule within working as a trainer and promotions. 

I will agree for a 3 - 6 month lease, than a year. 

I hope to have a private restroom, entrance would be awesome, and open kitchen. 

I'm not into random strangers over and parties, particular about the people I have as friends or even know where I live. I hope the same for you. 

I have a service dog thats 8 lbs and potty trained. :) 

Looking for someone who is part profressional/respectful/hippie ;) (not a hipster) 

Please email me if you think I may be a suited  match with the  following:
- a description of your property
- occupation  
- contact number and best time to contact.

Females only and correct spelling. Do not email me with overly written slang - that's just offensive.

I look forward to settle in June -  July.

Thank you

One of the most critical systems of your home is the plumbing system that smoothly carries water throughout your home when everything is working. 
When you have a clogged drain, leaky faucet, broken washing machine, standstill sump pump, a malfunctioning garbage disposal, a cracked sink, or an overflowing toilet, you need a plumber. 
Preferably, you need an experienced, plumber who knows exactly what they're doing. Even when nothing's broken or going wrong, keeping your kitchen and bath areas well-maintained and in good repair can help improve your home's value not to mention add to your enjoyment of living there. 
Keeping up with the maintenance and adding upgrades, such as replacing a sink, faucet, showerhead, toilet, or bathtub liner or wall surround, however, can be technically difficult and overwhelming, and that's where plumbing services, and the plumbers that list there, comes in.

Amenities include: 2 fireplaces, large living room, all-season sun-porch, dining room that seats 10, large kitchen w/ stainless steal appliances and granite counter-tops, great back-yard with outside patio area (including grill), library for quiet study/reading, rec room with billiards, large flat-screen TV & DVD, exercise equipment (including recumbent bike and work-out bag), washer/dryer, and 3 full/1half bath.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
I'm 31, gay, single and a non-smoker looking for an affordable small private room. Currently in Sunnyside paying $600 flat and working in Long Island City as a non-union doorman-concierge. I've been in the city 11 years and still love it everyday. I keep quiet around the house and am very respectful and tidy, cleaning as I go. I currently live with four other people and two cats and have no problems just looking to go somewhere farther out but between work and Rockaway Beach.

A little more about me: I work full time weekday mornings with a lot of young families and have been with this company a year and a half. I bike and explore the city when it's not cold and take pictures, grab coffee or tacos and hang out in parks. I'm a bit musical but self taught and mostly just as a hobby(have a couple guitars). Cooking is something I only do once a week at most and the same goes with drinking. My family is down south where I grew up.

I'm in no rush but willing to hear about any available opportunities in this ballpark.

Have a great day!

body:

June- Aug 15
Subletting 1 room in 2B 1b located 1 minute away from the Prospect Av R stop or 7min walk from FGR on 4av 9th st. Delis, restaurants, cafes, bars, laundry matts... all well within walking distance, Prospect Park too! I am moving in with my partner but really like the place otherwise.

You would be sharing the apartment with a mid 20s creative NYU student doing a masters degree in art and technology. He is fun and respectful, we share food, internet and stuff but that would be up to you two to decide. 

Electricity, heat, gas, water, trash... included! Rooms are huge (about 9x13ft), living room is huge too (2.5x room size)! It is partially underground but your room gets a good amount of natural light.  

The furniture can be negotiated. Please let me know you read this post by mentioning a little about yourself in the email. 

Moving date is flexible, prorated, (June...) and the lease goes until August 15. You could sign a lease after that.

I'm a self employed attorney in San Francisco with a flexible schedule and I like traveling to NYC (to see friends and work). 

Cannot airbnb my place but can possibly swap - hopefully for a decent, clean place in the Manhattan / Brooklyn area.

I'm flexible on travel time and have a very nice, contemporary loft-esq 1bd in SF. The apt is as about as good as it gets.

- Located in SF (city)
- In a National Park, wake up in the city looking out at the woods.
- Building comparable to 5 star hotel.
- Floor to ceiling windows
- Modern appliances 
- In unit laundry
- Gym
- Hiking trails at your front door
- For more info see http://www.thepresidiolandmark.com/

Pets - will not work.
Noise - quiet building so no parties, etc.
Process - yes, there will be vetting and plenty of it. On my end have excellent Yelp reviews (for my law practice), CA bar membership info, Airbnb reviews and plenty references from other home swaps (many of whom have become good friends).

E-mail if interested. We can chat by phone. 

Thanks
Doug

-Social and easy going
-Do enjoy social get together (with acceptance and respect for potential roommates, would even be cool if you joined in)
-Have no issue with 4/20 friendly - I don't personally smoke, but don't mind if you do :)
- I enjoy music, concerts, wine nights, art, long boarding, snowboarding, and a whole list of things!

I am willing to go up to 700.00 in rent (lower would be preferred of course, and will consider slightly higher) If you have any other questions for me please feel free to ask!

If this is something you'd be interested in send me an email and I will respond quickly :) Also please tell me a bit about yourself!

Cheers :)
title: Seeking Roommates For May/June, 2018.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
I'm a well educated female . Looking for a room with professional roommates . No smoking ,no drug and no drama . I ca live wth females ,couples or family . M budget is $600 utilities must be included . But i can help cook and cleaning . More Thank detail will be talk by phone . Thank ou for your time . .

We also have a small dog.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
[PLEASE NOTE: If you're seeing this post, then I'm still looking for an apartment. I've received several emails consisting of "are you still looking?" These will be deleted. Just send me information on what you're offering WITH PHOTOS:  RESPONSES WITHOUT PHOTOS WILL BE DELETED. I have received several legitimate responses, which I appreciate, but they're not quite what I'm looking for. In addition, I'm not looking for a roommate situation. This needs to be a private apartment with a separate entrance bathroom and kitchen. Thanks.]

I work off Battery Park and am currently living out in Suffolk. I'm looking to move to Queens in order to cut down my commute time, which is very long. I'm looking for a small studio or a one bedroom:

1. Something in the $850-$1000 range.

2. Decent neighborhood. No loud music, drugs, people hanging out at all hours, etc. 

3. Within walking distance of mass transit, preferably the subway as I want to stop using the LIRR.

4. Hopefully within walking distance of some food shopping and laundry.

5. Utilities included (heat, water, electric). Cable and WiFi I can do myself, but if they're included even better. If none of this is included I'm still interested in hearing what you have to offer.

6. I want to be able to get my mail at the address I live at. Right now I have to use a PO Box.

7. I work weekends and am off in the middle of the week. Many times I take other work on my days off. I'm very private, and just want to do my thing. So, should you be offering something in a private home, understand that I'm not looking for a roommate or buddy-buddy type situation. That being said I'm easy to get along with, very quiet, have no pets, am very clean, and I don't smoke. I pay my rent on time, every time.

8. Where I'm renting now is furnished. Yours doesn't have to be, but if it is, that's great.

9. I would prefer no kids or pets, especially if it's a basement apartment, due to noise issues.

I'm on a month to month lease so I can move with very short notice.

I'd prefer to deal with a private owner as opposed to a realtor. Any contact asking me to sign up for real estate or room share services will be ignored. When contacting me please include pictures of what you're offering.

Thanks.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hi 

We are an independent professional couple, looking to swap our Vienna apt with an apt in NYC. 

All NYC boroughs are welcome. Including suburbs of NYC.

Dates somewhat flexible.

We have a beautiful 1 bedroom apt in the heart of Vienna, Austria in Europe.

Tons of light; hardwood floors; fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher,
coffee maker;
bedroom # 1 with a full sized bed - sleeps 2 people
huge living room with dining table, tv, couch, Internet;
bathroom with bathtub and toilet; washing machine
linens, sheets and towels are provided;
dogs are allowed. :-)

We are happy to give you a live video tour of the apartment.

The apt is located in the 9th district of Vienna:

-5 min subway ride to city center (1st district) with the famous and
traditional coffee houses like Sacher, Demel, etc.;
the Staatsoper (opera house), Spanische Hofreitschule (the famous
spanish riding school), Hofburg ( the imperial palace), etc....
the famous shopping streets Kärntner Strasse and Graben...

-10min Subway ride to the "Naschmarkt", the famous market with a huge
variety of traditional and foreign food; the flea market (every
saturday);
a lot of good restaurants and bars;

-15min to the big shopping street Mariahilferstrasse, where you
can find everything you need; also a big variety of bars, restaurants
and coffee houses

Enjoy Vienna in the summer with its diverse cultural events and historic flair.

Vienna is located in the heart of Europe:

1 hour to Berlin, Germany by plane
2 hours to London, Great Britain by plane
1 hour to Prag, Czech Republic by plane
2 hours to Paris, France by plane
2,5 hours to Barcelona, Spain by plane
1,5 hours to Rome, Italy by plane
1hour 15min to Venice, Italy by plane
2,5 hours to Stockholm, Sweden by plane
etc...
also the eastern cities of Europe, like Budapest, Prague, Bratislava,
etc. are not far to reach by train.


If you are interested, please contact us with information about the apt, yourself and the neighborhood.

Thanks a lot.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
If you want to move to New York City from another state, then fine. The way to do this is to find a job where you live and save up money to move.

Many young people here think someone in NYC can host them for free, for a few months, while they look for a job? No. No one can afford that. This is a roommate or rental site. People who have a room need to charge MARKET RATE, because their landlord is charging THEM market rate.

So if you have a dream to move to NYC that's great. Save your money and move here. Sure some people can move here in college, they have rich parents and can prove it with bank statements. It's expensive to live here. Don't expect to move here with no money.

PLEASE, PLEASE do not come here to go to private college and take out enormous student loans for tuition and rent in Manhattan! If you DO decide to go to school here, NO ONE has to live a 5 minute walk to school. You DON'T have to live in the Village, Upper East Side or Upper West Side. Make do with a Metrocard and commute from Queens or whatever borough. This student loan debt to pay Manhattan rent is SICK.

If you are looking to "barter" for no money, please list your ad under "barters". Not this section.

Mature, responsible, respectful professional female seeking a 1 bedroom/1 bathroom condo/apartment. I have had very positive experiences with my last three landlords. I have excellent references and credit. 

MUST-HAVES include lots of natural light, hardwood floors, in-unit washer/dryer (NOT shared with another unit in the building or house), dishwasher, and off-street parking. I am open to towns located in Fairfield County.

While I do not have a pet at this time, I may need to take over responsibility for my elderly mother's faithful 12 year old Himalayan cat, if caring for her becomes too much for my mother. Therefore, the apartment/condo would need to be pet friendly. 

I am looking for a move-in date around June 1.

I am NOT looking to live in a converted garage or basement apartment. I am also not looking to live right by the highway, an electrical transformer, or a cell tower.

If you think you have a place that might be a good fit for me, please reach out through this listing with pictures of the place for rent. If you do not send photos, I will not be able to respond to your email. 

Thanks for your time and consideration.
title: Looking for someone to treat your rental like your own?

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Furnished private room includes closet, wifi, heating unit, flat screen TV (no cable, but has HDMI input), linens, some storage.  Shared bathroom.  Welcomed to use all apartment's common areas i.e full kitchen w/appliances, sunken living room, large foyer, study/library.  Foodstuffs, groceries, etc. at your own expense.

The building is well maintained and includes an elevator, coin laundry on ground floor.  The A train is less than a minute walk from front door. The 1 train is approx. a 10 minute walk at 181st & St. Nicolas.

Located in Hudson Heights. Neighborhood amenities include two supermarkets, two banks/ATMs, dry cleaners, pharmacy, Cafe Buunni indie coffee, Bennett Park, Fort Washington Park with Little Red Lighthouse, Fort Tryon Park/The Cloisters, and coming later this Fall the GWB Terminal Shopping Mall along the Broadway retail corridor.

I am a 45 yr old man - gay, quiet, clean, professional. I usually travel for work at least once a month for approx. five days.  Some of my interests are contemporary art, mid-century design, adventure travel, cultural activities in New York, reading print version of NY Times, etc.  I am easy-going, friendly but firmly no nonsense with regard to my apartment.

Preferences 
Looking for an employed, responsible, reliable, quiet, sociable, clean flatmate.  Prefer a man 21 - 45 (no one older than my age) and gay.
Looking for relatively short-term room shares i.e. from one week to three months.  However, I am open to accommodating a desire from a potential flatmate for a longer share term i.e. six months, nine months.
I am not considering anyone who wishes to bring furniture of any kind with them or who has pets.
Minimum of one reference required.

You may contact me thru CL mail relay. I am looking forward to hearing from all those interested.  I will respond to anyone who contacts me and am happy to discuss the room share, send additional photos, and answer all your questions.  However, I will only arrange visits to see the room, apartment, and building and close this deal, if we are both fairly confident after our initial e-mail exchange followed by a phone call/text message that we wish to move forward with this arrangement. This obviously will come down to you finding me virtually in an instant an agreeable person to share an apartment and vice versa.

Cheers.

title: LANDLORDS/HOMEOWNERS WANTED IMMEDIATELY

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Would you like an experienced housesitter to stay in your place while you're away?

I am a life coach, teacher, writer, and speaker. Originally from Washington, I've returned to D.C. after ten years in California, where I was housesitting and petsitting. I've lived in New York City a couple of times, so I know the city reasonably well.

I am a cat and dog lover, and pet "owners", when they return, always love the way their pets are. I would be delighted to housesit for you. In California, I sat for more than 70 people during the past ten years, and I have been asked back again at several places. I am available in January and in later months.

I am relatively quiet, meditate daily, do not drink or smoke, and rarely entertain guests (and then only to talk). I'm focused on writing my book on trends in the American collective unconscious, and I am working towards completing the first draft in the coming months. I want to get a goodly amount of writing done, so I'm looking for something fairly quiet, without a lot of distractions (that is, from people; distractions from animals are fine!). My apartment in Washington was large with a few fine things in it, so I'm used to careful attention and respect for the space.

I am available for both medium-term (depending on the dates) and long-term stays. Please contact me if you are interested, and indicate the starting date and your location (which part of the city, or your town).
